field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: CFG
field.description: GPTM Configuration - The GPTMCFG values are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 32-bit timer configuration. 0x1 32-bit real-time clock 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Reserved 0x4 16-bit timer configuration. The function is controlled by bits 1:0 of GPTMTAMR and GPTMTBMR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select 0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TACINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode 0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TAPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation 0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TAMRSU
field.description: Timer A Match Register Update mode 0: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next cycle. 1: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next time-out. If the timer is disabled (TAEN is clear) when this bit is set, GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (TASTALL is set), GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

field.name: TAPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output 0: Interrupt is disabled. 1: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TAILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TASNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Snap-Shot Mode 0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer A is configured in the periodic mode, the actual free-running value of Timer A is loaded at the time-out event into the GPTM Timer A (GPTMTAR) register.

field.name: TAWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer A Wait-On-Trigger 0: Timer A begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer A is enabled (TAEN is set in the GPTMCTL register), Timer A does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This bit must be clear for GP Timer Module 0, Timer A

field.name: TAMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A Match Interrupt Enable -0: The match interrupt is disabled. -1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTAMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TACDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Count Direction -0: The timer counts down. -1: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TAAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Alternate Mode -0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. -1: PWM mode is enabled. -Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear the TACM bit and configure the TAMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TACM
field.description: GPTM Timer A Capture Mode -0: Edge-Count mode -1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TAMR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Mode-0x0 Reserved -0x1 One-Shot Timer mode -0x2 Periodic Timer mode -0x3 Capture mode -The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TBCINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TBPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TBMRSU
field.description: Timer B Match RegisterUpdate mode 0: Update the GPTMBMATCHR and the GPTMBPR

field.name: TBPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Interrupt EnableThis bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising

field.name: TBILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TBSNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Snap-Shot Mode0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer B is configured in the periodic mode

field.name: TBWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer B Wait-On-Trigger0: Timer B begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer B is enabled (TBEN is set in the GPTMCTL register)

field.name: TBMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Match Interrupt Enable0: The match interrupt is disabled. 1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTBMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TBCDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Count Direction0: The timer counts down. 1: The timer counts up. When counting up

field.name: TBAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Alternate Mode0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. 1: PWM mode is enabled. Note: To enable PWM mode

field.name: TBCM
field.description: GPTM Timer B Capture Mode0: Edge-Count mode GPTM1632S Specification version 0.5 Page 21 TI Confidential NDA Restrictions 1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TBMR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Mode0x0 Reserved 0x1 One-Shot Timer mode 0x2 Periodic Timer mode 0x3 Capture mode The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register.

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: TBPWML
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Output Level0: Output is unaffected. 1: Output is inverted.

field.name: TBOTE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Output Trigger Enable0: The output Timer B ADC trigger is disabled. 1: The output Timer B ADC trigger is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: TBEVENT
field.description: GPTM Timer B Event Mode0x0 Positive edge 0x1 Negative edge 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Both edges

field.name: TBSTALL
field.description: GPTM Timer B Stall Enable0: Timer B continues counting while the processor is halted by the debugger. 1: Timer B freezes counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

field.name: TBEN
field.description: GPTM Timer B Enable0: Timer B is disabled. 1: Timer B is enabled and begins counting or the capture logic is enabled based on the GPTMCFG register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Output Level0: Output is unaffected. 1: Output is inverted.

field.name: TAOTE
field.description: GPTM Timer A Output Trigger Enable0: The output Timer A ADC trigger is disabled. 1: The output Timer A ADC trigger is enabled.

field.name: RTCEN

field.name: TAEVENT

field.name: TASTALL

field.name: TAEN

field.name: SYNC11
field.description: Synchronize GPTM Timer 110x0 GPTM11 is not affected. 0x1 A timeout event for Timer A of GPTM11 is triggered. 0x2 A timeout event for Timer B of GPTM11 is triggered. 0x3 A timeout event for both Timer A and Timer B of GPTM11 is triggered.

field.name: CFG
field.description: GPTM Configuration - The GPTMCFG values are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 32-bit timer configuration. 0x1 32-bit real-time clock 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Reserved 0x4 16-bit timer configuration. The function is controlled by bits 1:0 of GPTMTAMR and GPTMTBMR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select 0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TACINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode 0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TAPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation 0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TAMRSU
field.description: Timer A Match Register Update mode 0: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next cycle. 1: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next time-out. If the timer is disabled (TAEN is clear) when this bit is set, GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (TASTALL is set), GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

field.name: TAPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output 0: Interrupt is disabled. 1: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TAILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TASNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Snap-Shot Mode 0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer A is configured in the periodic mode, the actual free-running value of Timer A is loaded at the time-out event into the GPTM Timer A (GPTMTAR) register.

field.name: TAWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer A Wait-On-Trigger 0: Timer A begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer A is enabled (TAEN is set in the GPTMCTL register), Timer A does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This bit must be clear for GP Timer Module 0, Timer A

field.name: TAMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A Match Interrupt Enable -0: The match interrupt is disabled. -1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTAMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TACDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Count Direction -0: The timer counts down. -1: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TAAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Alternate Mode -0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. -1: PWM mode is enabled. -Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear the TACM bit and configure the TAMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TACM
field.description: GPTM Timer A Capture Mode -0: Edge-Count mode -1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TAMR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Mode-0x0 Reserved -0x1 One-Shot Timer mode -0x2 Periodic Timer mode -0x3 Capture mode -The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TBCINTD

field.name: TBPLO

field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: CFG
field.description: GPTM Configuration - The GPTMCFG values are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 32-bit timer configuration. 0x1 32-bit real-time clock 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Reserved 0x4 16-bit timer configuration. The function is controlled by bits 1:0 of GPTMTAMR and GPTMTBMR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select 0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TACINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode 0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TAPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation 0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TAMRSU
field.description: Timer A Match Register Update mode 0: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next cycle. 1: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next time-out. If the timer is disabled (TAEN is clear) when this bit is set, GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (TASTALL is set), GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

field.name: TAPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output 0: Interrupt is disabled. 1: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TAILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TASNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Snap-Shot Mode 0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer A is configured in the periodic mode, the actual free-running value of Timer A is loaded at the time-out event into the GPTM Timer A (GPTMTAR) register.

field.name: TAWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer A Wait-On-Trigger 0: Timer A begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer A is enabled (TAEN is set in the GPTMCTL register), Timer A does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This bit must be clear for GP Timer Module 0, Timer A

field.name: TAMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A Match Interrupt Enable -0: The match interrupt is disabled. -1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTAMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TACDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Count Direction -0: The timer counts down. -1: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TAAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Alternate Mode -0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. -1: PWM mode is enabled. -Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear the TACM bit and configure the TAMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TACM
field.description: GPTM Timer A Capture Mode -0: Edge-Count mode -1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TAMR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Mode-0x0 Reserved -0x1 One-Shot Timer mode -0x2 Periodic Timer mode -0x3 Capture mode -The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TBCINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TBPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TBMRSU
field.description: Timer B Match RegisterUpdate mode 0: Update the GPTMBMATCHR and the GPTMBPR

field.name: TBPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Interrupt EnableThis bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising

field.name: TBILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TBSNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Snap-Shot Mode0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer B is configured in the periodic mode

field.name: TBWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer B Wait-On-Trigger0: Timer B begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer B is enabled (TBEN is set in the GPTMCTL register)

field.name: TBMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Match Interrupt Enable0: The match interrupt is disabled. 1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTBMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TBCDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Count Direction0: The timer counts down. 1: The timer counts up. When counting up

field.name: TBAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Alternate Mode0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. 1: PWM mode is enabled. Note: To enable PWM mode

field.name: TBCM
field.description: GPTM Timer B Capture Mode0: Edge-Count mode GPTM1632S Specification version 0.5 Page 21 TI Confidential NDA Restrictions 1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TBMR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Mode0x0 Reserved 0x1 One-Shot Timer mode 0x2 Periodic Timer mode 0x3 Capture mode The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register.

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: TBPWML
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Output Level0: Output is unaffected. 1: Output is inverted.

field.name: TBOTE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Output Trigger Enable0: The output Timer B ADC trigger is disabled. 1: The output Timer B ADC trigger is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: TBEVENT
field.description: GPTM Timer B Event Mode0x0 Positive edge 0x1 Negative edge 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Both edges

field.name: TBSTALL
field.description: GPTM Timer B Stall Enable0: Timer B continues counting while the processor is halted by the debugger. 1: Timer B freezes counting while the processor is halted by the debugger.

field.name: TBEN
field.description: GPTM Timer B Enable0: Timer B is disabled. 1: Timer B is enabled and begins counting or the capture logic is enabled based on the GPTMCFG register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: CFG
field.description: GPTM Configuration - The GPTMCFG values are defined as follows: Value Description 0x0 32-bit timer configuration. 0x1 32-bit real-time clock 0x2 Reserved 0x3 Reserved 0x4 16-bit timer configuration. The function is controlled by bits 1:0 of GPTMTAMR and GPTMTBMR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select 0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TACINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode 0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TAPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation 0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TAMRSU
field.description: Timer A Match Register Update mode 0: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next cycle. 1: Update the GPTMAMATCHR and the GPTMAPR, if used on the next time-out. If the timer is disabled (TAEN is clear) when this bit is set, GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated when the timer is enabled. If the timer is stalled (TASTALL is set), GPTMTAMATCHR and GPTMTAPR are updated according to the configuration of this bit.

field.name: TAPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interrupt Enable This bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising, falling, or both edges of the CCP output 0: Interrupt is disabled. 1: Interrupt is enabled. This bit is only valid in PWM mode.

field.name: TAILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TASNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Snap-Shot Mode 0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer A is configured in the periodic mode, the actual free-running value of Timer A is loaded at the time-out event into the GPTM Timer A (GPTMTAR) register.

field.name: TAWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer A Wait-On-Trigger 0: Timer A begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer A is enabled (TAEN is set in the GPTMCTL register), Timer A does not begin counting until it receives a trigger from the timer in the previous position in the daisy chain. This bit must be clear for GP Timer Module 0, Timer A

field.name: TAMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer A Match Interrupt Enable -0: The match interrupt is disabled. -1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTAMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TACDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Count Direction -0: The timer counts down. -1: The timer counts up. When counting up, the timer starts from a value of 0x0.

field.name: TAAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer A Alternate Mode -0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. -1: PWM mode is enabled. -Note: To enable PWM mode, you must also clear the TACM bit and configure the TAMR field to 0x2.

field.name: TACM
field.description: GPTM Timer A Capture Mode -0: Edge-Count mode -1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TAMR
field.description: GPTM Timer A Mode-0x0 Reserved -0x1 One-Shot Timer mode -0x2 Periodic Timer mode -0x3 Capture mode -The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TCACT
field.description: Timer Compare Action Select0: Disable compare operations 1: Toggle State on Time-Out 2: Clear CCP on Time-Out 3: Set CCP on Time-Out 4: Set CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 5: Clear CCP immediately and toggle on Time-Out 6: Set CCP immediately and clear on Time-Out 7: Clear CCP immediately and set on Time-Out

field.name: TBCINTD
field.description: One-Shot/Periodic Interrupt Mode0: Normal Time-Out Interrupt 1: Mask Time-Out Interrupt

field.name: TBPLO
field.description: Legacy PWM operation0: Legacy operation 1: CCP is set to 1 on time-out

field.name: TBMRSU
field.description: Timer B Match RegisterUpdate mode 0: Update the GPTMBMATCHR and the GPTMBPR

field.name: TBPWMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Interrupt EnableThis bit enables interrupts in PWM mode on rising

field.name: TBILD
field.description: GPTM Timer A PWM Interval Load Write 0: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next clock cycle. If the pre-scaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next clock cycle. 1: Update the GPTMTAR register with the value in the GPTMTAILR register on the next timeout. If the prescaler is used, update the GPTMTAPS register with the value in the GPTMTAPR register on the next timeout.

field.name: TBSNAPS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Snap-Shot Mode0: Snap-shot mode is disabled. 1: If Timer B is configured in the periodic mode

field.name: TBWOT
field.description: GPTM Timer B Wait-On-Trigger0: Timer B begins counting as soon as it is enabled. 1: If Timer B is enabled (TBEN is set in the GPTMCTL register)

field.name: TBMIE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Match Interrupt Enable0: The match interrupt is disabled. 1: An interrupt is generated when the match value in the GPTMTBMATCHR register is reached in the one-shot and periodic modes.

field.name: TBCDIR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Count Direction0: The timer counts down. 1: The timer counts up. When counting up

field.name: TBAMS
field.description: GPTM Timer B Alternate Mode0: Capture/Compare mode is enabled. 1: PWM mode is enabled. Note: To enable PWM mode

field.name: TBCM
field.description: GPTM Timer B Capture Mode0: Edge-Count mode GPTM1632S Specification version 0.5 Page 21 TI Confidential NDA Restrictions 1: Edge-Time mode

field.name: TBMR
field.description: GPTM Timer B Mode0x0 Reserved 0x1 One-Shot Timer mode 0x2 Periodic Timer mode 0x3 Capture mode The Timer mode is based on the timer configuration defined by bits 2:0 in the GPTMCFG register.

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of areserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products

field.name: TBPWML
field.description: GPTM Timer B PWM Output Level0: Output is unaffected. 1: Output is inverted.

field.name: TBOTE
field.description: GPTM Timer B Output Trigger Enable0: The output Timer B ADC trigger is disabled. 1: The output Timer B ADC trigger is enabled.

field.name: TBEN

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DI_REQ
field.description: Read current value of DI_REQ signal. Writing 0 to this bit forces a sync with slave, ensuring that req will be 0. It is recommended to write 0 to this register before power down of the master.

field.name: DI_ACK
field.description: Read current value of DI_ACK signal

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESETLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESET
field.description: Write 1 to reset the ADI slave

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CONFLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: WAITFORACK
field.description: A transaction on the ADI interface does not end until ack has been received from the slave when this bit is set.

field.name: ADICLKSPEED
field.description: Sets the period of an ADI transactions. All transactions takes an even number of clock cycles,- ADI clock rising edge occurs in the middle of the period. Data and ctrl to slave is set up in beginning of cycle, and data from slave is read in after the transaction 00: An ADI transaction takes 2 master clock cyclkes 01: An ADI transaction takes 4 master clock cycles 10: And ADI Transaction takes 8 master clock cycles 11: An ADI transaction takes 16 master clock cycles

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DI_REQ
field.description: Read current value of DI_REQ signal. Writing 0 to this bit forces a sync with slave, ensuring that req will be 0. It is recommended to write 0 to this register before power down of the master.

field.name: DI_ACK
field.description: Read current value of DI_ACK signal

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESETLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESET
field.description: Write 1 to reset the ADI slave

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CONFLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: WAITFORACK
field.description: A transaction on the ADI interface does not end until ack has been received from the slave when this bit is set.

field.name: ADICLKSPEED
field.description: Sets the period of an ADI transactions. All transactions takes an even number of clock cycles,- ADI clock rising edge occurs in the middle of the period. Data and ctrl to slave is set up in beginning of cycle, and data from slave is read in after the transaction 00: An ADI transaction takes 2 master clock cyclkes 01: An ADI transaction takes 4 master clock cycles 10: And ADI Transaction takes 8 master clock cycles 11: An ADI transaction takes 16 master clock cycles

register.name: OUTLOW
register.description: Output register for LSW randon number read access to LSW of 64-bit random number

field.name: OUT
field.description: Least significant word half of 64-bit word of random data, only valid when the 'ready' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register has value '1'.

register.name: OUTHI
register.description: To Read MSW of Random Number read access to MSW of 64-bit random number

field.name: OUT
field.description: Most significant word half of 64-bit word of random data, only valid when the 'ready' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register has value '1'.

field.name: NEED_CLOCK
field.description: 1' indicates that the TRNG is busy generating entropy or is in one of its test modes - clocks may not be turned off and the power supply voltage must be kept stable. This bit is a direct mirror of the 'TRNG_need_clock' output signal of the module.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SHUTDOWN_OFLO
field.description: 1' = the number of FROs shut down after a second 'error event' (i.e. the number of '1' bits in the TRNG_ALARMSTOP register) has exceeded the threshold set by 'shutdown_threshold' in the TRNG_ERRORCNT register. Writing a '1' to bit [1] of the TRNG_INTACK register clears this bit to '0' again.

field.name: READY
field.description: 1' = data is available in the TRNG_OUTPUT_H/L registers. Acknowledging this state by writing a '1' to bit [0] of the TRNG_INTACK register clears this bit to '0', if a new number is already available in the internal register of the TRNG, the number is directly clocked into the result register. In this case the status bit is asserted again, after one clock cycle.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SHUTDOWN_OFLO
field.description: 1' = allow the 'shutdown_oflo' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register to activate the (active LOW) 'SINTREQUEST' output.

field.name: READY
field.description: 1' = allow the 'ready' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register to activate the (active LOW) 'SINTREQUEST' output.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SHUTDOWN_OFLO
field.description: Write a '1' to clear the 'shutdown_oflo' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register. Need not be written with a '0' after writing a '1', always reads '0'.

field.name: READY
field.description: Write a '1' to clear the 'ready' bit in the TRNG_STATUS register. Need not be written with a '0' after writing a '1', always reads '0'.

field.name: STARTUP_CYCLES
field.description: This field determines the number of samples (between 28 and 224) taken to gather entropy from the FROs during startup. If the written value of this field is zero, the number of samples is 224, otherwise the number of samples equals the written value times 28. This field can only be written when 'enable_trng' was '0' before the write.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ENABLE_TRNG
field.description: Setting this bit to '1' starts the TRNG, gathering entropy from the FROs for the number of samples determined by the value in the 'startup_cycles' field. Resetting this bit to '0' forces all TRNG logic back into the idle state immediately.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NO_LFSR_FB
field.description: 1' = Remove XNOR feedback from the main LFSR, converting it into a normal shift register for the XOR-ed outputs of the FROs (shifting data in on the LSB side). A '1' also forces the LFSR to sample continuously. This bit can only be set to '1' when 'test_mode' is also set to '1'.

field.name: TEST_MODE
field.description: 1' = Enables access to the TRNG_COUNT and TRNG_LFSR_L/M/H registers (the latter are cleared before enabling access) and keep 'TRNG_need_clock' output active HIGH for testing purposes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MAX_REFILL_CYCLES
field.description: This field determines the maximum number of samples (between 28 and 224) taken to re-generate entropy from the FROs after reading out a 64 bits random number. If the written value of this field is zero, the number of samples is 224, otherwise the number of samples equals the written value times 28. This field can only be modified while 'enable_trng' in TRNG_CONTROL is '0'.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SAMPLE_DIV
field.description: This field directly controls the number of CLK input cycles between samples taken from the FROs. Default value 0 indicates that samples are taken every CLK cycle, maximum value 15d takes one sample every 16 CLK cycles. This field must be set to a value such that the slowest FRO (even under worst-case conditions) has a cycle time less than twice the sample period. This field can only be modified while 'enable_trng' in TRNG_CONTROL is '0'.

field.name: MIN_REFILL_CYCLES
field.description: This field determines the minimum number of samples (between 26 and 224) taken to re-generate entropy from the FROs after reading out a 64 bits random number. If the value of this field is zero, the number of samples is fixed to the value determined by the 'max_refill_cycles' field, otherwise the minimum number of samples equals the written value times 64 (which can be up to 214). The number of samples defined here cannot be higher than the number defined by the 'max_refill_cycles' field (i.e. that field takes precedence). This field can only be modified while 'enable_trng' in TRNG_CONTROL is '0'.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SHUTDOWN_COUNT
field.description: Read-only, indicates the number of '1' bits in the TRNG_ALARMSTOP register. This field is 6 bits wide to allow up to 32 'ones' to be indicated; the actual maximum value equals the number of FROs.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SHUTDOWN_THRESHOLD
field.description: Threshold setting for generating the 'shutdown_oflo' interrupt, which is activated when the 'shutdown_count' value in this register exceeds the value set here.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ALARM_THRESHOLD
field.description: Alarm detection threshold for the repeating pattern detectors on each FRO. An FRO 'alarm event' is declared when a repeating pattern (of up to four samples length) is detected continuously for the number of samples defined by this field's value. Reset value 255d should keep the number of 'alarm events' to a manageable level.

field.name: FRO_ENABLES
field.description: Enable bits for the individual FROs, a '1' in bit [n] enables FRO 'n'. Default state is all '1's to enable all FROs after power-up (note that they are not actually started up before the 'enable_trng' bit in the TRNG_CONTROL register is set to '1'). Bits are automatically forced to '0' here (and cannot be written to '1') while the corresponding bit in the TRNG_ALARMSTOP register has value '1'.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRO_DETUNES
field.description: De-tune bits for the individual FROs, a '1' in bit [n] lets FRO 'n' run approximately 5% faster. The value of one of these bits may only be changed while the corresponding FRO is turned off (by temporarily writing a '0' in the corresponding bit of the TRNG_FROENABLE register).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRO_ALARMMASKS
field.description: Logging bits for the 'alarm events' of individual FROs. A '1' in bit [n] indicates FRO 'n' experienced an 'alarm event'.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FRO_ALARMSTOPS
field.description: Logging bits for the 'alarm events' of individual FROs, a '1' in bit [n] indicates FRO 'n' experienced more than one 'alarm event' in quick succession and has been turned off. A '1' in this field forces the corresponding bit in the TRNG_FROENABLE register to '0'.

field.name: LFSR_31_0
field.description: Bits [31:0] of the main entropy accumulation LFSR. Register can only be accessed when 'test_mode' bit in TRNG_CONTROL is set to '1', register contents will be cleared to zero before access is enabled.

field.name: LFSR_63_32
field.description: Bits [63:32] of the main entropy accumulation LFSR. Register can only be accessed when 'test_mode' bit in TRNG_CONTROL is set to '1', register contents will be cleared to zero before access is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: LFSR_80_64
field.description: Bits [80:64] of the main entropy accumulation LFSR. Register can only be accessed when 'test_mode' bit in TRNG_CONTROL is set to '1', register contents will be cleared to zero before access is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SAMPLE_COUNTER
field.description: Sample counter used by control FSM. Counter can only be accessed when 'test_mode' bit in TRNG_CONTROL is set to '1'.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TEST_PATTERN
field.description: Repeating sequence of bits to be fed into the selected FRO delay chain ('test_patt_fro' = '1') and/or the selected FRO error detection circuit ('test_patt_det' = '1'). This field is rotated right over one bit once every sample period when either of these control bits is '1', bit [16] is the actual pattern bit fed into the test target.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Bits should be written with a '0' and should be ignored on a read.

field.name: TEST_SELECT
field.description: Number of the FRO to be tested, value should be in range 0 - 23.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TEST_PATT_DET
field.description: 1' = Repeatedly feed 'test_pattern' into the error detection circuit of the FRO selected by the 'test_select' field. This bit can only be set to '1' when 'test_mode' in TRNG_CONTROL is '1' too.

field.name: TEST_PATT_FRO
field.description: 1' = Repeatedly feed 'test_pattern' into the delay chain of the FRO selected by the 'test_select' field by forcing the corresponding 'TEST_fro_enable' output LOW and forcing the corresponding 'TEST_fro_testin' output to the state of bit [16] of this register. This bit can only be set to '1' when 'test_mode' in TRNG_CONTROL is '1' too.

field.name: TEST_EN_OUT
field.description: 1' = Enable the 'tst_fro_clk_out' output, connecting to the FRO selected by the 'test_select' field. This bit can only be set to '1' when 'test_mode' in TRNG_CONTROL is '1' too.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: NR_OF_FROS
field.description: Number of FROs implemented in this TRNG, value 24 (decimal) for now.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MAJOR_HW_REVISION
field.description: 4 bits binary encoding of the major hardware revision number.

field.name: MINOR_HW_REVISION
field.description: 4 bits binary encoding of the minor hardware revision number.

field.name: HW_PATCH_LEVEL
field.description: 4 bits binary encoding of the hardware patch level, initial release will carry value zero.

field.name: COMPLEMENT_OF_BASIC_EIP_NUMBER
field.description: Bit-by-bit logic complement of bits [7:0], EIP 75t gives 0xB4.

field.name: BASIC_EIP_NUMBER
field.description: 8 bits binary encoding of the EIP number, EIP 75t gives 0x4B.

register.name: MMR_STATUS_EN
register.description: A read only reg indicating the Overall interrupt status

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: READY
field.description: Indicates that when asserted Random number ready to be read out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: REVISION
field.description: The revision number of this module is Rev 2.0.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: IDLE_TYPE
field.description: "00" for Force idle & "10" for smart idle

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

register.name: MMR_STATUS_SET
register.description: A read write register where the contents of mmr_status_raw can be read from this address.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SW_INT
field.description: To set interrupts for testability purpose by soft ware

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SOFT_RESET
field.description: Write '1' to soft reset , reset will be low for 4-5 clock cycles.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: PULSE_INT_CLEAR
field.description: write 1 to clear the pulse interrupt

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: These bits should be written with zero and ignored on reads

field.name: STATUS
field.description: TRNG Interrupt status.

register.name: IRQENABLE
register.description: The TRNG_IRQENABLE is a read write register that enables the interrupt of the TRNG engine

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable the TRNG Interrupt.

register.name: GPF
register.description:
Register: GP_FLAGS
This register contains some general purpose SPI related flags. All flag bits herein are set ('1') by the peripheral when the respective event occurs. If an event occurs while the MCU domain is off, the event flag will be set when the MCU domain is powered on. This allows the MCU software to notice and take action on events that have occurred while the MCU domain has been off. Flags are sticky '1' until cleared by software by writing '0' to the respective bit field. Writing '1' to bit fields does not set the respective flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: BYTEDONEEV
field.description:
BYTE_DONE_EV: A complete byte transfer event. This event is also available from SPIS Core to the AON Event Fabric. The event is cleared by accessing this register bit field.
1 = A complete byte transfer (TX/RX) has taken place.
0 = No byte done event detected since last cleared by SW.

field.name: PRXOFEV
field.description:
PRX_OF_EV: SPI-Core Parallel RX data overflow event.
1 = An overflow condition of sampled SI-pin data is detected in the SPI-Core due to that the MCU-SPI module has not been able to sample the PRX data bus. The SPI Core is able to buffer one byte of data sampled on the SI-pin. This event is eventually to occur during SPI traffic when the MCU domain is in power-down. Later, when the MCU wakes up, the overflow condition is registered - and this flag is set.
0 = No overflow condition is detected since last cleared by SW.

field.name: INCOMEV
field.description:
INCOM_EV: Incomplete SPI transaction event.
1 = Chip select has been de-asserted during an ongoing incomplete byte transfer.
0 = No SPI incomplete event detected since last cleared by SW.

field.name: CSEV
field.description:
CS_EV: Chip select event.
1 = Chip select assertion is detected.
0 = Chip select has not been asserted since last cleared by SW.

register.name: GPFD
register.description:
Register: GP_FLAGS_DEBUG
This register is intended for debug access only. The bit fields are aligned equally as the GP_FLAGS register. The bit fields are only settable, and are not readable. A read attempt will only result in 0x00. The main purpose of this register is to use it in combination with respective event signals for interrupt debugging.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

register.name: GPFEM
register.description:
Register: GP_FLAGS_EVENT_MASK
The flag event signal is a combination of all flag associated bit fields that is defined for the peripheral. One or more flags can be enabled as event triggers - and may be polled in SW in order to determine the event source. This register defines a mask for which of the flags defined in the GP_FLAGS register that are to be enabled as flag event sources.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DMADONERXF
field.description:
DMA_DONE_RXF: Enable bit for DMA-done RX FIFO-channel.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: DMADONETXF
field.description:
DMA_DONE_TXF: Enable bit for DMA-done TX FIFO-channel.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: BYTEDONE
field.description:
BYTE_DONE: Enable bit for GP_FLAGS<BYTE_DONE_EV> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: PRXOF
field.description:
PRX_OF: Enable bit for GP_FLAGS<PRX_OF_EV> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: INCOM
field.description:
INCOM: Enable bit for GP_FLAGS<INCOM_EV> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: CS
field.description:
CS: Enable bit for GP_FLAGS<CS_EV> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source. 0 = Flag is not an event source.

register.name: CFG
register.description:
Register: CONFIG
This register is used to define the SPI clock polarity, configuration of first bit MOSI and MISO LSB/MSB SPI data and selection of whether to use the single request or request to the DMA controller. Both the TX FIFO and RX FIFO have their own unique DMA channel. The ?X_FIFO_STATUS_EVENT_SEL registers are used to select the source that will trigger the DMA.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: RXFDMAREQTP
field.description:
RXF_DMA_REQ_TP: RX FIFO DMA request type select.
1 = Single request is chosen (request output is set to '0'). 0 = Request is chosen (single request output is set to '0').

field.name: TXFDMAREQTP
field.description:
TXF_DMA_REQ_TP: TX FIFO DMA request type select.
1 = Single request is chosen (request output is set to '0'). 0 = Request is chosen (single request output is set to '0').

field.name: PRXSWP
field.description:
PRXSWP: MOSI first bit configuration.
1 = First bit is MSB. 0 = First bit is LSB.

field.name: PTXSWP
field.description:
PTXSWP: MISO first bit configuration.
1 = First bit is MSB. 0 = First bit is LSB.

field.name: POL
field.description:
POL: SPI clock polarity.
A copy of the polarity value is latched in the AON SPI-Core module. Consequently, if the MCU domain is powered down, the polarity value is withheld and this bit field is updated once MCU powers up.
1 = CPOL=1 CPHA=0 0 = CPOL=0 CPHA=0

register.name: TXFF
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_FLAGS
All flag bits herein are set ('1') by the peripheral when the respective condition is met. Flags are sticky '1' until cleared by software by writing '0' to the respective bit field. Writing '1' to bit fields does not set the respective flag. If software attempts to clear a flag that still is in condition to be set, the peripheral takes precedence and the flag remains set.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: OFLOW
field.description:
O_FLOW: TX FIFO overflow flag.
1 = The TX FIFO has experienced overflow due to that the MCU has attempted to write data into an already full TX FIFO (sticky high until cleared by SW).
0 = The TX FIFO has not experienced overflow since last cleared by SW.

field.name: UFLOW
field.description:
U_FLOW: TX FIFO underflow flag.
1 = The TX FIFO has experienced underflow due to data request from the SPI Slave Core while TX FIFO is empty (sticky high until cleared by SW). Default 'empty' data sent out from the TX FIFO is 0x00.
0 = The TX FIFO has not experienced underflow since last cleared by SW.

field.name: HASDATA
field.description:
HAS_DATA: TX FIFO has one or more bytes flag.
1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has become greater than zero (not empty) (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the TX FIFO has data (not empty), the flag remains set.
0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has not become greater than zero (i.e. is empty) since last cleared by SW.

field.name: LEWM
field.description: LE_WM: TX FIFO less than or equal to TX FIFO water mark level flag. 1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has become equal to or less than TX FIFO water mark level (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while number of bytes in TX FIFO is equal to or less than TX FIFO water mark level, the flag remains set. 0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has not become equal to or less than the TX FIFO water mark level since last cleared by SW.

field.name: GEWM
field.description:
GE_WM: TX FIFO greater than or equal to TX FIFO water mark level flag.
1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has become equal to or greater than TX FIFO water mark level (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while number of bytes in TX FIFO is equal to or greater than TX FIFO water mark level, the flag remains set.
0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO has not become equal to or greater than the TX FIFO water mark level since last cleared by SW.

field.name: EMPTY
field.description:
EMPTY: TX FIFO empty flag.
1 = TX FIFO has become empty or is empty (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the TX FIFO is empty, the flag remains set.
0 = TX FIFO has not become empty since last cleared by SW.

field.name: FULL
field.description:
FULL: TX FIFO full flag.
1 = TX FIFO has become full or is full (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the TX FIFO is full, the flag remains set.
0 = TX FIFO has not become full since last cleared by SW.

register.name: TXFFD
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_FLAGS_DEBUG
This register is intended for debug access only. The bit fields are aligned equally as the TX_FIFO_FLAGS register. The bit fields are only settable, and are not readable. A read attempt will only result in 0x00. The main purpose of this register is to use it in combination with respective event signals for interrupt debugging. Neither the FIFO conditions nor the status register are modified due to actions performed on this register.

field.name: OFLOW
field.description: OFLOW: TX FIFO overflow flag. 1 = TX FIFO overflow event is forced to 1

field.name: UFLOW
field.description: UFLOW: TX FIFO underflow flag. 1 = TX FIFO underflow event is forced to 1

field.name: HASDATA
field.description: HASDATA: TX FIFO has data flag. 1 = TX FIFO has data event is forced to 1

field.name: LEWM
field.description: LEWM: TX FIFO water mark level event. 1 = TX FIFO lower than water mark event is forced to 1

field.name: GEWM
field.description: GEWM: TX FIFO GE water mark level event. 1 = TX FIFO greater than or equal event is forced to 1

field.name: EMPTY
field.description: EMPTY: TX FIFO empty event. 1 = TX FIFO empty event is forced to 1

field.name: FULL
field.description: FULL: TX FIFO full event. 1 = TX FIFO full event is forced to 1

register.name: TXFFEM
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_FLAGS_EVENT_MASK
The flag event signal is a combination of all flag associated bit fields that is defined for the peripheral. One or more flags can be enabled as event triggers - and may be polled in SW in order to determine the event source. This register defines a mask for which of the flags defined in the TX_FIFO_FLAGS register that are to be enabled as flag event sources.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: OFLOW
field.description:
O_FLOW: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<O_FLOW> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: UFLOW
field.description:
U_FLOW: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<U_FLOW> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: HASDATA
field.description:
HAS_DATA: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<HAS_DATA> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: LEWM
field.description:
LE_WM: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<LE_WM> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: GEWM
field.description:
GE_WM: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<GE_WM> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: EMPTY
field.description:
EMPTY: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<EMPTY> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

field.name: FULL
field.description:
FULL: Enable bit for TX_FIFO_FLAGS<FULL> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.
0 = Flag is not an event source.

register.name: TXFS
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_STATUS
This register reflects the current status of the TX FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: HASDATA
field.description:
HAS_DATA: TX FIFO has one or more bytes status.
1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is greater than zero (not empty).
0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is zero (empty).

field.name: LEWM
field.description:
LE_WM: TX FIFO less than or equal to TX FIFO water mark level status.
1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is equal to or less than TX FIFO water mark level.
0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is greater than TX FIFO water mark level.

field.name: GEWM
field.description:
GE_WM: TX FIFO greater than or equal to TX FIFO water mark level status.
1 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is equal to or greater than TX FIFO water mark level.
0 = Number of bytes in TX FIFO is less than TX FIFO water mark level.

field.name: EMPTY
field.description:
EMPTY: TX FIFO empty status.
1 = TX FIFO is empty.
0 = TX FIFO is not empty.

field.name: FULL
field.description:
FULL: TX FIFO full status.
1 = TX FIFO is full.
0 = TX FIFO is not full.

register.name: TXFSES
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_STATUS_EVENT_SEL
This register is used to select one of the status bit fields in the TX_FIFO_STATUS register as source for an event output - typically to be used together with a DMA controller.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SEL
field.description: TX FIFO Status source select

register.name: TXFWM
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_WM
This register defines the water mark threshold level of the TX FIFO. When a water mark threshold is defined, it may be used in conjunction with the respective water mark related bit fields in both the status register and flag register. An appropriate water mark flag can be enabled as an interrupt source in order for SW to act on the FIFO. Likewise, a suitable water mark status bit field can be selected as a DMA event source in order for the DMA controller to act on the FIFO and offload the MCU.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WM
field.description:
THRESHOLD:
0b0000 - 0 bytes 0b0001 - 1 byte 0b0010 - 2 bytes ... 0b1110 - 14 bytes 0b1111 - 15 bytes

register.name: TXFPUSH
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_PUSH
This register is used to push data into the TX FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: D
field.description: Data to be pushed into TX FIFO.

register.name: TXFFLUSH
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_FLUSH
This register is used to flush the contents of the TX FIFO. Related status fields will update accordingly. Related flag fields are not cleared by flushing the FIFO. Some related flag fields may be set due to that the FIFO becomes empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: EXEC
field.description:
EXEC: Execute TX FIFO flush command.
1 = TX FIFO is flushed.
0 = TX FIFO is not flushed (untouched).

register.name: TXFSRP
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_SNIFF_READ_POINTER
This register returns the TX FIFO read pointer. The FIFO is circular. The read pointer points to the location of the FIFO element which is the next byte that is to be popped/read out of the FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: RP
field.description:
RP<3:0> Read pointer at FIFO element #
0b0000 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #0 0b0001 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #1 ... 0b1110 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #14 0b1111 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #15

register.name: TXFSWP
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_SNIFF_WRITE_POINTER
This register returns the TX FIFO write pointer. The FIFO is circular. The write pointer points to the location in the FIFO where the next element that is to be pushed/written will be stored.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WP
field.description:
WP<3:0> Write pointer at FIFO element #
0b0000 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #0 0b0001 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #1 ... 0b1110 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #14 0b1111 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #15

register.name: TXFSNB
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_SNIFF_NUM_BYTES
This register returns the number of bytes that resides inside the FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: NB
field.description:
NB<4:0> Number of bytes in FIFO
0b00000 - 0 bytes in FIFO 0b00001 - 1 bytes in FIFO ... 0b01110 - 14 bytes in FIFO 0b01111 - 15 bytes in FIFO 0b10000 - 16 bytes in FIFO 0b10001 to 0b11111 - unreachable values

register.name: RXFF
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_FLAGS
All flag bits herein are set ('1') by the peripheral when the respective condition is met. Flags are sticky '1' until cleared by software by writing '0' to the respective bit field. Writing '1' to bit fields does not set the respective flag. If software attempts to clear a flag that still is in condition to be set, the peripheral takes precedence and the flag remains set.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: OFLOW
field.description:
O_FLOW: RX FIFO overflow flag.
1 = The RX FIFO has experienced overflow due to that the MCU has attempted to write data into an already full RX FIFO (sticky high until cleared by SW).
0 = The RX FIFO has not experienced overflow since last cleared by SW.

field.name: UFLOW
field.description:
U_FLOW: RX FIFO underflow flag.
1 = The RX FIFO has experienced underflow due to data request from the SPI Slave Core while RX FIFO is empty (sticky high until cleared by SW). Default 'empty' data sent out from the RX FIFO is 0x00.
0 = The RX FIFO has not experienced underflow since last cleared by SW.

field.name: HASDATA
field.description:
HAS_DATA: RX FIFO has one or more bytes flag.
1 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has become greater than zero (not empty) (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the RX FIFO has data (not empty), the flag remains set.
0 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has not become greater than zero (i.e. is empty) since last cleared by SW.

field.name: LEWM
field.description: LE_WM: RX FIFO less than or equal to RX FIFO water mark level flag. 1 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has become equal to or less than RX FIFO water mark level (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while number of bytes in RX FIFO is equal to or less than RX FIFO water mark level, the flag remains set. 0 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has not become equal to or less than the RX FIFO water mark level since last cleared by SW.

field.name: GEWM
field.description:
GE_WM: RX FIFO greater than or equal to RX FIFO water mark level flag.
1 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has become equal to or greater than RX FIFO water mark level (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while number of bytes in RX FIFO is equal to or greater than RX FIFO water mark level, the flag remains set.
0 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO has not become equal to or greater than the RX FIFO water mark level since last cleared by SW.

field.name: EMPTY
field.description:
EMPTY: RX FIFO empty flag.
1 = RX FIFO has become empty or is empty (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the RX FIFO is empty, the flag remains set.
0 = RX FIFO has not become empty since last cleared by SW.

field.name: FULL
field.description:
FULL: RX FIFO full flag.
1 = RX FIFO has become full or is full (sticky high until cleared by SW). If SW attempts to clear the flag while the RX FIFO is full, the flag remains set.
0 = RX FIFO has not become full since last cleared by SW.

register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_FLAGS_DEBUG
This register is intended for debug access only. The bit fields are aligned equally as the RX_FIFO_FLAGS register. The bit fields are only settable, and are not readable. A read attempt will only result in 0x00. The main purpose of this register is to use it in combination with respective event signals for interrupt debugging. Neither the FIFO conditions nor the status register are modified due to actions performed on this register.

field.name: LEWM
field.description: LEWM: RX FIFO water mark level event. 1 = RX FIFO lower than water mark event is forced to 1

field.name: GEWM
field.description: GEWM: RX FIFO GE water mark level event. 1 = RX FIFO greater than or equal event is forced to 1

field.name: EMPTY
field.description: EMPTY: RX FIFO empty event. 1 = RX FIFO empty event is forced to 1

field.name: FULL
field.description: FULL: RX FIFO full event. 1 = RX FIFO full event is forced to 1

field.description:
U_FLOW: Enable bit for RX_FIFO_FLAGS<U_FLOW> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.

field.description:
GE_WM: Enable bit for RX_FIFO_FLAGS<GE_WM> as event signal.
1 = Flag is enabled as an event source.

field.name: HASDATA

1 = Number of bytes in RX FIFO is greater than zero (not empty).

field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SEL
field.description: RX FIFO Status source select

Register: RX_FIFO_WM
This register defines the water mark threshold level of the RX FIFO. When a water mark threshold is defined, it may be used in conjunction with the respective water mark related bit fields in both the status register and flag register. field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WM
field.description:
THRESHOLD:
0b0000 - 0 bytes 0b0001 - 1 byte 0b0010 - 2 bytes ... 0b1110 - 14 bytes 0b1111 - 15 bytes

register.name: RXFPOP
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_POP
This register is used to pop data from the RX FIFO. Access to an empty RX FIFO returns a read value of 0x00 - while also causing an underflow condition.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: D
field.description: Data popped from RX FIFO.

register.name: RXFFLUSH
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_FLUSH
This register is used to flush the contents of the RX FIFO. Related status fields will update accordingly. Related flag fields are not cleared by flushing the FIFO. Some related flag fields may be set due to that the FIFO becomes empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: EXEC
field.description:
EXEC: Execute RX FIFO flush command.
1 = RX FIFO is flushed.
0 = RX FIFO is not flushed (untouched).
