register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_SNIFF_READ_POINTER
This register returns the RX FIFO read pointer. The FIFO is circular. The read pointer points to the location of the FIFO element which is the next byte that is to be popped/read out of the FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: RP
field.description:
RP<3:0> Read pointer at FIFO element #
0b0000 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #0 0b0001 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #1 ... 0b1110 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #14 0b1111 - Read Pointer at FIFO element #15

register.name: RXFSWP
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_SNIFF_WRITE_POINTER
This register returns the RX FIFO write pointer. The FIFO is circular. The write pointer points to the location in the FIFO where the next element that is to be pushed/written will be stored.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WP
field.description:
WP<3:0> Write pointer at FIFO element #
0b0000 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #0 0b0001 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #1 ... 0b1110 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #14 0b1111 - Write Pointer at FIFO element #15

register.name: RXFSNB
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_SNIFF_NUM_BYTES
This register returns the number of bytes that resides inside the FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: NB
field.description:
NB<4:0> Number of bytes in FIFO
0b00000 - 0 bytes in FIFO 0b00001 - 1 bytes in FIFO ... 0b01110 - 14 bytes in FIFO 0b01111 - 15 bytes in FIFO 0b10000 - 16 bytes in FIFO 0b10001 to 0b11111 - unreachable values

register.name: TXFSD
register.description:
Register: TX_FIFO_SNIFF_DATA
The contents of the TX FIFO can be read through direct access of the internal memory elements without intervention to the FIFO controller logic. The FIFO works as a ring buffer. There are 16 memory elements, each eight bits wide.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: EL
field.description: FIFO element

register.name: RXFSD
register.description:
Register: RX_FIFO_SNIFF_DATA
The contents of the RX FIFO can be read through direct access of the internal memory elements without intervention to the FIFO controller logic. The FIFO works as a ring buffer. There are 16 memory elements, each eight bits wide.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: EL
field.description: FIFO element

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WAITSTATES
field.description: Flash reading wait states (USERCODE range). Number of clock cycles to acces flash.Range 1 to 255, Default 3, Setting 0 will behave like minimum = 1

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SAMPLE_PERIOD
field.description: Sample and hold timing Time between sampling. In clock cyclces prescaled by SAMP_PRE. Default 999 (1 ms with prescaler to 1 us)

field.name: PRE_SAMPLE
field.description: Prescaler for SAMPLE_PERIOD. Default 47 (Prescaler 1 MHz / 1 us )

field.name: SAMHOLD_SA
field.description: Sample and hold timing Time for sampling pulse width. In clockcycles. Default 47 (1 us)

field.name: SAMHOLD_SU
field.description: Sample and hold timing Time for enable setup before sampling pulse. In clockcycles. Default 47 (1 us)

field.name: BANK_0_EFUSE
field.description: Bank 0 Efuse register. To be written with factory configuration data before flash module can initialize. Default (For first simulation): 00100011010111011010011011000101

field.name: EFUSE_BLANK
field.description: Efuse scanning detected a blank efuse ROM

field.name: EFUSE_TIMEOUT
field.description: Efuse scanning resulted in timeout error.

field.name: EFUSE_CRC_ERROR
field.description: Efuse scanning resulted in scan chain CRC error.

field.name: EFUSE_ERRCODE
field.description: Same as EFUSEERROR.CODE[4:0]

field.name: SAMHOLD_DIS
field.description: 1' when sample and hold are disabled and stable

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Fast version of the FMC FMSTAT:BUSY bit. This flag is valid immediately after the operation setting it (FMSTAT is delayed some cycles)

field.name: POWER_MODE
field.description: Actual low power mode. 0 : Low power 1 : Active

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WAIT_SYSCODE
field.description: Flash reading wait states (SYSCODE range). Number of clock cycles to acces flash.Range 1 to 255, Default 3, Setting 0 will behave like minimum = 1

field.name: CONFIGURED
field.description: Sticky. Module configured. Disable write access to some configuration registers.

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DIS_READACCESS
field.description: Disable read access to flash. This bit will disable all read accesses to the flash. The purpose is to block read access from other masters when changing the 48 MHz clock source. Firmware has to disable all CPU accesses to the flash before setting this bit.

field.name: ENABLE_SWINTF
field.description: Enable Software Interface read access. This bit is writeprotected by the 'CONFIGURED' bit.

field.name: PROTECTCFG
field.description: Activate CFG read protection. Range defined in PCFGSTART and PCFGEND registers. This bit is writeprotected by the 'CONFIGURED' bit.

field.name: DIS_STANDBY
field.description: Disable standby functionality in read idle state

field.name: DIS_IDLE
field.description: Disable sample and hold functionality in read idle state

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SYSCODE_START
field.description: Syscode addressing offset. This register will point to the sector number in the flash where syscode starts. The pupose of syscode is to emulate ROM code in a flash version of cc26xx. The ROM code is placed in the flash from the specified sector. Sectorsize is 4 Kbyte.

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SECTORS
field.description: Flash size. The number of flash sectors in the configured device. Read access to sectors equal to this number or higher will result in an error. The CCFG is the sector (FLASH_SIZE - 1) Writing to this register is disabled by the CONFIG:CONFIGURED bit.

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: ADDR
field.description: CFG Read protect.Start address of the protected range. Address is byte address but must be 32 bit aligned.Writing to this register is disabled by the CONFIG:CONFIGURED bit.

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: ADDR
field.description: CFG Read protect. Last address of the protected range. Address is byte address but must be 32 bit aligned.Writing to this register is disabled by the CONFIG:CONFIGURED bit.

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: FWLOCK
field.description: LOCK register for FWFLAG. Writing to FWFLAG requires FWLOCK = 5

field.name: RESERVED32
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: FWFLAG
field.description: Flags available for Firmware. Writing to FWFLAG requires FWLOCK = 5

register.name: EFUSE
register.description: The instruction register holds the code that is to be executed by the eFuse controller. The codes for each instruction, along with the description of each instruction, are detailed in the eFuse controller instructions section. Unlike the other registers, the instruction register is written and read from bits [34:30] of the eFuse controller's JTAG/IEEE1500 control register. With the exception of the DumpWord instruction, when the instruction register is written, bits [29:0] of the controller are ignored. The reason for this is to shorten test time by scanning only 10 bits into the controller's JTAG/IEEE1500 control register to initiate an instruction. The DumpWord instruction expects the address to dump as bits [15:0]. Once an instruction code is loaded, the controller immediately executes the instruction. For this reason, all of the other registers that supply data for the instruction should be written before the Instruction register is written. Loading any instruction while the controller is executing a previously loaded instruction causes the controller to interrupt the previous instruction, report an error (depending on the previous instruction), and start executing the newinstruction. This can cause problems, depending on the interrupted instruction, and should be avoided.

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INSTRUCTION
field.description: Holds the eFuse controller instruction.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DUMPWORD
field.description: Holds the address to use for the DumpWord instruction. All other instructions ignore these bits.

register.name: EFUSEADDR
register.description: The address register is used to select the FuseROM and FuseROM row to be read or written

field.name: BLOCK
field.description: FuseROM block select. These five bits select which of the 32 possible FuseROMs is used in the following instruction.

field.name: ROW
field.description: FuseROMrow address. Given the FuseROMselected by the FuseROM block select, these 11 bits select which row of the FuseROM is used in the following instruction. Since the maximum number of rows for a FuseROM is 64, only bits [5:0] of the FuseROM row address should be used. Address bits [10:6] should be set low ('0').

register.name: DATAUPPER
register.description: The data register holds the FuseROM row data selected by the address register.

field.name: SPARE
field.description: Unused range

field.name: P
field.description: Protect (P). Once this bit is set high (1), the other bits in the row can no longer be programmed or read back. A dumpword instruction will return all zeroes. The actual data of that row will still be loaded into the fuse scan chain during an autoload operation.

field.name: R
field.description: Redundant (R). Once this bit is set high (1), the row is marked as having a failure and is replaced by a redundant row.

field.name: EEN
field.description: ECC Enable (EEN). When set high (1), this bit marks the row as a Time N repair row. Data bits [31:26] are used as ECC for data bits [25:0]. The data is read and only 26 bits are sent to the fuse scan chain from the row during autoload

register.name: DATALOWER
register.description: ROW 0 has a special description of the bitfields!

field.name: DATA
field.description: FuseROM row data. These 32 bits are written to or read from the FuseROM. These 32 bits are also the fuse data that is scanned into the fuse scan chain during an autoload operation. The order that the bits are scanned into the chain is bit [0] (LSB) to bit [31] (MSB).

field.name: IDLEGATING
field.description: Control of clock internal gating while module is idle. There is one bit per clock. The actual register width depends on the number of functional clocks controlled.

field.name: SLAVEPOWER
field.description: Slave interface power management control. Idle request/acknowledge control

field.name: GATING
field.description: Internal autogating control.

field.name: RESETDONE
field.description: Reset Done, This is the OCP interface reset done. Will be '1' before access to register.

register.name: ACC
register.description: Several instructions use this register to count various aspects of their execution. The specific value held in this register is explained in the discussion of each instruction.

field.name: ACCUMULATOR
field.description: hese bits hold data after the execution of various instructions

register.name: BOUNDARY
register.description: The boundary register is used during testing. If the register is enabled, the inputs listed on the register block the input ports and drive the controller's internal circuitry with the value stored in the register. The boundary register can also be used to drive the output signals. The following input signals can be set using the boundary register: EFC_FDI , SYS_WS_READ_STATES , SYS_ECC_OVERRIDE_EN , SYS_DIEID_AUTOLOAD_EN , SYS_REPAIR_EN The following output signals can be set using the boundary register: , EFC_AUTOLOAD_ERROR , EFC_INSTRUCTION_ERROR , EFC_INSTRUCTION_INFO, EFC_SELF_TEST_ERROR

field.name: DISROW0
field.description: Disable read row 0. When high, disables read of row 0 during initial access of FuseROM.

field.name: EFC_SELF_TEST_ERROR
field.description: Drives the error signal output when the Output enable is set.

field.name: EFC_INSTRUCTION_INFO
field.description: Drives the error signal output when the Output enable is set.

field.name: EFC_INSTRUCTION_ERROR
field.description: Drives the error signal output when the Output enable is set.

field.name: EFC_AUTOLOAD_ERROR
field.description: Drives the error signal output when the Output enable is set.

field.name: OUTPUTENABLE
field.description: The error output signals are driven by the values of the boundary register if the signal is set high (4'b1111).

field.name: YS_ECC_SELF_TEST_EN
field.description: Drives the SYS_ECC_SELF_TEST_EN input when the Input enable is set.

field.name: SYS_ECC_OVERRIDE_EN
field.description: This bit drives the SYS_ECC_OVERRIDE_EN input when Input enable is set.

field.name: EFC_FDI
field.description: This bit drives the EFC_FDI input when Input enable is set.

field.name: SYS_DIEID_AUTOLOAD_EN
field.description: This bit drives the SYS_DIEID_AUTOLOAD_EN input when Input enable is set.

field.name: SYS_REPAIR_EN
field.description: This bus sets the SYS_REPAIR_EN inputs when Input enable is set.

field.name: SYS_WS_READ_STATES
field.description: These bits drive the SYS_WS_READ_STATES inputs when Input enable is set.

field.name: INPUTENABLE
field.description: Input enable. These bit are used to control whether the input ports or the boundary register drives the inputs. If set high (4'b1111), the inputs to the controller are driven by the values of the boundary register. The Self-Test Signals register and Self-Test cycles register are also controlled by these bits.

field.name: KEY
field.description: Key flag. If the proper key is loaded into the key code bits, this bit will read a 1.

register.name: EFUSEKEY
register.description: The eFuse controller does not have to be reset during power-up of the system. To protect the FuseROMs from an inadvertent power-up in program mode, the key register must first be set with the hexadecimal value of 96969696h before the program instruction will work.

field.name: CODE
field.description: Key code. These 32 bits are used to set the key (96969696h) for the program instruction.

register.name: EFUSERELEASE
register.description: For every release of the FuseFarm controller soft macro, the release register is hard-coded with a date-stamp that identifies when the controllerwas released. TheRTL used to create the FuseFarmcontroller soft macro design can then be determined from this register

field.name: ODPYEAR
field.description: Release code indicating year of ODP controller macro release

field.name: ODPMONTH
field.description: Release code indicating month of ODP controller macro release.

field.name: ODPDAY
field.description: Release code indicating day of ODP controller macro release.

field.name: EFUSEYEAR
field.description: Release code indicating year of eFuse controller macro release.

field.name: EFUSEMONTH
field.description: Release code indicating month of eFuse controller macro release.

field.name: EFUSEDAY
field.description: Release code indicating day of eFuse controller macro release.

register.name: EFUSEPINS
register.description: The pins register is used during testing. The pins register can be read at any time and returns the current values of the following ports of the controller. If the boundary register is controlling the inputs to the eFuse controller, the pins register return the input port values, not the values stored in the boundary register.

field.name: EFC_SELF_TEST_DONE
field.description: Output pin

field.name: EFC_SELF_TEST_ERROR
field.description: Output pin

field.name: SYS_ECC_SELF_TEST_EN
field.description: Input pin

field.name: EFC_INSTRUCTION_INFO
field.description: Output pin

field.name: EFC_INSTRUCTION_ERROR
field.description: Output pin

field.name: EFC_AUTOLOAD_ERROR
field.description: Output pin

field.name: SYS_ECC_OVERRIDE_EN
field.description: Input pin

field.name: EFC_READY
field.description: Output pin

field.name: EFC_FCLRZ
field.description: Output pin

field.name: SYS_DIEID_AUTOLOAD_EN
field.description: Input pin

field.name: SYS_REPAIR_EN
field.description: Input pins

field.name: SYS_WS_READ_STATES
field.description: Input pin

register.name: EFUSECRA
register.description: This register stores the column repair address (CRA) data bits to be programmed into the addressed FuseROM row's CRA bits.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Data bits to be programmed into the CRA bits of the addressed row

register.name: EFUSEREAD
register.description: The read register is used to control the ROM clock read pulse width and set the sense amp margin limits.

field.name: DATABIT
field.description: Read data bit. If the protect (P) bit is set in any row, only P bits are reported during a read, and the other bits are zero. See Table 20 for details on the behavior of the read_data_bit.

field.name: READCLOCK
field.description: ROM clock read pulse width. Active high. Specifies the number of internal clock cycles that the FuseROM clock (pin FROM_CLK) is high ('1'). These bits override the SYS_WS_READ_STATE[3:0] ports. Values are: Bit Width (4b'0000) 1 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0001) 1 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0010) 2 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0011) 3 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0100) 4 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0101) 5 * SYS_CLK period (4b'0110) - (4b'1111) Not used

field.name: DEBUG
field.description: Used for debug purposes. Keep low for normal operation.

field.name: SPARE
field.description: Unused bit

field.name: MARGIN
field.description: Combined margin. The bits set the sense amp margin limits according to the following table. The FuseROM Compiler section in the GS60 Customer In-field Programmable FuseROM specification shows more information on combined margin. Margin(1:0) Trip Point Label Description 00 5K Normal Normal read 01 2K Margin 0 Margin test for unblown fuses. An unblown fuse should have a resistance below the trip point. 10 22K Margin 1A Margin test for blown fuses. Higher compare resistance than normal. 11 60K Margin 1B Margin test for blown fuses. Higher margin resistance than normal or Margin 1A.

register.name: EFUSEPROGRAM
register.description: When the program instruction is executed, the data register's value is used to determine which bits are blown in the FuseROM row selected by the address register. One sweep of all the FuseROM bits is made: The bits that are low ('0') in the FuseROM are not blown, but high ('1') bits in the data register are blown by the controller. The first attempt at blowing aFuseROMbitmay not be successful, and more than one sweep of the FuseROM row may be needed. If this is the case, the FuseROM row may be swept again. The programregister controls several aspects of the programoperation

field.name: COMPAREDISABLE
field.description: Compare disable. Before any FuseROM bit is actually blown, the value of the data register is compared to the FuseROM data bits in the row selected by the address register. If the data register is already equal to the FuseROMrowdata, the rowis not blown, and the programinstruction is aborted. Error code 5b 01101 (for more information, see FuseFarm error codes) is placed on EFC_ERROR ports. To avoid this and force the program instruction to continue, set this bit to 1.

field.name: CLOCKSTALL
field.description: 16-bit FuseROM clock stall pulse width. Active low. After the controller attempts to program the data register value into the FuseROM row selected by the address register, the FROM_CLK signal is held low ('0') for a specified number of internal clock cycles to separate each pass of the controller. These bits determine the number of clock cycles that the controller pauses between each sweep of the FuseROM row.

field.name: VPPTOVDD
field.description: Programsignal for FuseROMVPP-to-VDD shorting switch. This bitmust be set high before executing the program instruction and low after program is completed. The eFuse controller output FROM_ENSW is created from this signal. The FROM_ENSW signal is used to disable ('1') and enable ('0') the FuseROM VPP-to-VDD shorting switch during program operation.

field.name: ITERATIONS
field.description: 4-bit maximum write iterations. This register sets the maximum number of sweeps that the program instruction uses to make the FuseROM row equal to the value in the data register. If the eFuse controller sweeps the number of times set in the maximum write iterations bits, an error code (5b'00111 or 5b'01000) is reported ((for more information, see FuseFarm error codes), and the program instruction sets the EFC_READY port high ('1') and JTAG_TDO high ('1') for one clock cycle

field.name: WRITECLOCK
field.description: 9-bit FuseROMclock write pulse width. Active low. These bits determine the width of the write phase (i.e., FROM_CLK = '0') of the FROM_CLK signal. In most instances, the width of the FROM_CLK write phase relative to the internal clock is simply equal to the unsigned decimal equivalent of the binary code. However, when this value is less than or equal to one, the following table should be used: Read pulse width Write pulse width FROM_CLK == '0' FROM_CLK == '1' 000 000000000 raw raw 000 000000001 1 1 001 000000000 1 1 001 000000001 1 1 The FROM_CLK signal in Figure 38 shows the write pulse signal for various program register values.

register.name: EFUSEERROR
register.description: Some instructions return an error/status code when completed. This code is the same value that appears on the EFC_ERROR port of the eFuse controller. An error/status code of 00000 means that the instruction completed successfully.

field.name: DONE
field.description: Instruction done. Set after each instruction is done. Should be cleared by the interfaces. Updated by hardware but writable to clear.

field.name: CODE
field.description: Error/Status code. These five bits hold the error or status code that was returned by the instruction that was executed. Updated by hardware but writable to clear.

field.name: FROMN
field.description: Is set if any row in the entire FROM has a single-bit error. For each FROM, one bit is selected. For FuseROM2, bit 1 is set. For FuseROM3, bit 2 is set. Only rows that have the EEN bit set can contribute to this error. If the sys_ecc_override_en bit is set, then any row can contribute to this error.

field.name: FROM0
field.description: Is set if any row that has its EEN bit set from rows 3-N has a single-bit error for FROM 0. If the sys_ecc_override_en bit is set, then all rows from 3-N can contribute to this error.

field.name: FROMN
field.description: Is set if any row in the entire FROM has a two-bit error. For each FROM, one bit is selected. For FuseROM2, bit 1 is set. For FuseROM3, bit 2 is set. Only rows that have the EEN bit set can contribute to this error. If the sys_ecc_override_en bit is set, then any row can contribute to this error.

field.name: FROM0
field.description: Is set if any row that has its EEN bit set from rows 3-N has a two-bit error for FROM 0. If the sys_ecc_override_en bit is set, then all rows from 3- N can contribute to this error.

field.name: CYCLES
field.description: The self-test cycles register can override the value on the port sys_ecc_self_test_cycles. It drives the input upon the setting of bits [3:0] of the boundary register to 4'b1111.

field.name: SIGNATURE
field.description: The self-test signature register can override the value on the port sys_ecc_self_test_signature. It drives the input upon the setting of bit [3:0] of the boundary register to 4'b1111.

field.name: FRDCNTL_RESERVED_31_28
field.description: Reserved

field.name: IFLUSH_HOLD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FRDCNTL_RESERVED_23_17
field.description: Reserved

field.name: IDLEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FRDCNTL_RESERVED_15_12
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RWAIT
field.description: Read Wait State. This field contains the number of wait states in a read access. FCLK_period = HCLK_period X (RWAIT + 1), FSM state machine operations is usually twice this amount.

field.name: FRDCNTL_RESERVED_07_05
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ASWSTEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FRDCNTL_RESERVED_03_01
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RM
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FSPRD_RESERVED_31_28
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ROM_KEY
field.description: ROM configurations only. When configured to talk to ROMs instead of flash memory, these four bits provide an activation key to the ROM test bank. Writing a "1010" to this field will enable the ROM test bank. Any other value will disable this bank. If the ROM_KEY is active then any read in the test ROM range will be considered good and if it is not active all reads to this range will return an abort. The test ROM range is usually bigger than the actual ROM.

field.name: FSPRD_RESERVED_23_17
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DIS_PREEMPT
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: RMBSEM
field.description: Read Margin Bank Select. When either RM1 or RM0 is set the RMBSELx with each bit corresponds to a bank forces the selected bank(s) to be read in the chosen margin mode. The unselected bank(s) will still be read in normal mode. The selected read margin mode will remain in effect on the bank until changed. Because read margin needs several cycles of setup time to take effect the bank must have a couple of dummy reads before it can return the true read margin values.

field.name: FSPRD_RESERVED_07_02
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RM1
field.description: Read Margin 1. When set enables Read Margin 1 mode

field.name: RM0
field.description: Read Margin 0. When set enables Read Margin 0 mode

field.name: FEDACCTRL1_RESERVED_31_25
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SUSP_IGNR
field.description: Suspend Ignore. 1=ignore the CPU_EMUSUSP and VBUSP_EMUDBG suspend signals and allows the error bits to set even in suspend mode. It also allows the FMC to un-freeze the error bits and other registers by reading the FUNC_ERR_ADDR register even in with suspend active. 0=FMC blocks all errors from setting the error bits in suspend mode and blocks the un-freezing of the bits and registers by reading the FUNC_ERR_ADDR register. The CPU_EMUSUSP and VBUSP_EMUDBG signals have normal functions. The CPU suspend signal should not be confused with the suspend command in the FSM.

field.name: FEDACCTRL1_RESERVED_23_20
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EDACMODE
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FEDACCTRL1_RESERVED_15_11
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EOFEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: EZFEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: EPEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FEDACCTRL1_RESERVED_07_06
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EOCV
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: EZCV
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: EDACEN
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FEDACCTRL2_RESERVED_31_16
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SEC_THRESHOLD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FCOR_ERR_CNT_RESERVED_31_16
field.description: Reserved

field.name: COR_ERR_CNT
field.description: Not Used in CC26.

field.name: FCOR_ERR_ADD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FCOR_ERR_POS_RESERVED_31_10
field.description: Reserved

field.name: B2_ERR
field.description: Not used on CC26.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26.

field.name: SERR_POS
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FEDACSTATUS_RESERVED_31_26
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RVF_INT
field.description: When this bit is one, it indicates that FSM command `read_verify' has found a mismatch and has suspended. The error event and this status bit are enabled by setting the RV_INT_EN bit in the FSM_ST_MACHINE register. This flag must be cleared by writing a one to this bit in order to clear the event generation.

field.name: FSM_DONE
field.description: When this bit is one, it indicates that FSM has finished its operation after the FSM_EXECUTE was set. The event and this status bit are enabled by setting the FSM_INT_EN bit in the FSM_ST_MACHINE register. Check the FMSTAT flag register, for any error that might have resulted from this FSM operation. Check the BUSY bit in the FMSTAT register if polling is used instead of interrupts.

field.name: COM3_MAL_GOOD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: COM2_MAL_GOOD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: ECC3_MAL_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: ECC2_MAL_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: COMB2_BUS_MAL_GOOD
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: ECCB2_MAL_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: B2_UNC_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: B2_COR_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Reserved

field.name: B2_ERR_IS_EE
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: D_UNC_ERR
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: ERR_ZERO_FLG

field.name: ERR_PRF_FLG
field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.description: Reserved

field.name: SECTORID1_INVERSE

field.description: Not Used in CC26

field.name: FPRIM_ADD_TAG_RESERVED_31_23
field.description: Reserved
