field.name: WDTLOAD
field.description: This register is the 32-bit interval value used by the 32-bit counter. When this register is written, the value is immediately loaded and the counter restarts counting down from the new value. If the WDTLOAD register is loaded with 0x0000.0000, an interrupt is immediately generated.

field.name: WDTVALUE
field.description: This register contains the current count value of the timer.

field.name: WRC
field.description: Write Complete The WRC values are defined as follows: Value Description 0 A write access to one of the WDT1 registers is in progress. A write access is not in progress, and WDT1 registers can be read or written.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: INTTYPE
field.description: Watchdog Interrupt Type Watchdog Interrupt Type The INTTYPE values are defined as follows: Value Description 0 Watchdog interrupt is a standard interrupt. 1 Watchdog interrupt is a non-maskable interrupt.

field.name: RESEN
field.description: Watchdog Reset Enable The RESEN values are defined as follows: Value Description 0 Disabled. 1 Enable the Watchdog module reset output.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Watchdog Interrupt Enable The INTEN values are defined as follows: Value Description 0 Interrupt event disabled (once this bit is set, it can only be cleared by a hardware reset). 1 Interrupt event enabled. Once enabled, all writes are ignored.

field.name: WDTICR
field.description: This register is the interrupt clear register. A write of any value to this register clears the Watchdog interrupt and reloads the 32-bit counter from the WDTLOAD register. Value for a read or reset is indeterminate.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: WDTRIS
field.description: This register is the raw interrupt status register. Watchdog interrupt events can be monitored via this register if the controller interrupt is masked. Watchdog Raw Interrupt Status Value Description 1 A watchdog time-out event has occurred. 0 The watchdog has not timed out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: WDTMIS
field.description: This register is the masked interrupt status register. The value of this register is the logical AND of the raw interrupt bit and the WDT interrupt enable bit. WDT Masked Interrupt Status Value Description: 1 An unmasked watchdog time-out event has occurred. 0 The watchdog has not timed out or is masked.

register.name: TEST
register.description: WDT Test This register provides user-enabled stalling when the microcontroller asserts the CPU halt flag during debug.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

field.name: STALL
field.description: Watchdog Stall Enable, Value Description, 1 If the microcontroller is stopped with a debugger, the watchdog timer stops counting. Once the microcontroller is restarted, the watchdog timer resumes counting. 0 The watchdog timer continues counting if the microcontroller is stopped with a debugger.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit.

register.name: LOCK
register.description: WDT Lock (WDTLOCK) Writing 0x1ACC.E551 to the WDTLOCK register enables write access to all other registers. Writing any other value to the WDTLOCK register re-enables the locked state for register writes to all the other registers. Reading the WDTLOCK register returns the lock status rather than the 32-bit value written. Therefore, when write accesses are disabled, reading the WDTLOCK register returns 0x0000.0001 (when locked; otherwise, the returned value is 0x0000.0000 (unlocked)).

field.name: WDTLOCK
field.description: Watchdog Lock A write of the value 0x1ACC.E551 unlocks the watchdog registers for write access. A write of any other value reapplies the lock, preventing any register updates. A read of this register returns the following values: Value Description 0x0000.0001 Locked 0x0000.0000 Unlocked

peripheral.name: I2C0
peripheral.description: Registers Fields should be considered STATIC unless otherwise noted (as DYNAMIC)

register.name: SOAR
register.description: I2C Slave Own Address This register consists of seven address bits that identify this I2C device on the I2C bus.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: OAR
field.description: I2C slave own address This field specifies bits A6 through A0 of the slave address.

register.name: SSTAT
register.description: I2C Slave Control/Status This register functions as a control register when written, and a status register when read.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: FBR
field.description: First byte received 1: The first byte following the slave's own address has been received. 0: The first byte has not been received. This bit is only valid when the RREQ bit is set and is automatically cleared when data has been read from the I2CSDR register. Note: This bit is not used for slave transmit operations.

field.name: TREQ
field.description: Transmit request 1: The I2C controller has been addressed as a slave transmitter and is using clock stretching to delay the master until data has been written to the I2CSDR register. 0: No outstanding transmit request.

field.name: RREQ
field.description: Receive request 1: The I2C controller has outstanding receive data from the I2C master and is using clock stretching to delay the master until data has been read from the I2CSDR register. 0: No outstanding receive data

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: DA
field.description: Device active 0: Disables the I2C slave operation 1: Enables the I2C slave operation

register.name: SDR
register.description: I2C Slave Data This register contains the data to be transmitted when in the Slave Transmit state, and the data received when in the Slave Receive state.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Data for transfer This field contains the data for transfer during a slave receive or transmit operation. When written this register is used to transmit data. When read, this address returns the last data received.

register.name: SIMR
register.description: I2C Slave Interrupt Mask This register controls whether a raw interrupt is promoted to a controller interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: STOPIM
field.description: Stop condition interrupt mask 1: The STOP condition interrupt is sent to the interrupt controller when the STOPRIS bit in the I2CSRIS register is set. 0: The STOPRIS interrupt is supressed and not sent to the interrupt controller.

field.name: STARTIM
field.description: Start condition interrupt mask 1: The START condition interrupt is sent to the interrupt controller when the STARTRIS bit in the I2CSRIS register is set. 0: The STARTRIS interrupt is supressed and not sent to the interrupt controller.

field.name: DATAIM
field.description: Data interrupt mask 1: The data received or data requested interrupt is sent to the interrupt controller when the DATARIS bit in the I2CSRIS register is set. 0: The DATARIS interrupt is surpressed and not sent to the interrupt controller.

register.name: SRIS
register.description: I2C Slave Raw Interrupt Status This register specifies whether an interrupt is pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: STOPRIS
field.description: Stop condition raw interrupt status 1: A STOP condition interrupt is pending. 0: No interrupt This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the STOPIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

field.name: STARTRIS
field.description: Start condition raw interrupt status 1: A START condition interrupt is pending. 0: No interrupt This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the STARTIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

field.name: DATARIS
field.description: Data raw interrupt status 1: A data received or data requested interrupt is pending. 0: No interrupt This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the DATAIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

register.name: SMIS
register.description: I2C Slave Masked Interrupt Status This register specifies whether an interrupt was signaled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: STOPMIS
field.description: Stop condition masked interrupt status 1: An unmasked STOP condition interrupt is pending. 0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the STOPIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

field.name: STARTMIS
field.description: Start condition masked interrupt status 1: An unmasked START condition interrupt is pending. 0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the STARTIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

field.name: DATAMIS
field.description: Data masked interrupt status 1: An unmasked data received or data requested interrupt is pending. 0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to the DATAIC bit in the I2CSICR register.

register.name: SICR
register.description: I2C Slave Interrupt Clear This register clears the raw interrupt. A read of this register returns no meaningful data.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: STOPIC
field.description: Stop condition interrupt clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPRIS bit in the I2CSRIS register and the STOPMIS bit in the I2CSMIS register. A read of this register returns no meaningful data.

field.name: STARTIC
field.description: Start condition interrupt vlear Writing 1 to this bit clears the STARTRIS bit in the I2CSRIS register and the STARTMIS bit in the I2CSMIS register. A read of this register returns no meaningful data.

field.name: DATAIC
field.description: Data interrupt clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the DATARIS bit in the I2CSRIS register and the DATAMIS bit in the I2CSMIS register. A read of this register returns no meaningful data.

register.name: MSA
register.description: This register consists of eight bits: seven address bits (A6-A0), and a Receive/Send bit, which determines if the next operation is a Receive (High), or Transmit (Low).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: SA
field.description: I2C slave address

field.name: RS
field.description: Receive and send The R/S bit specifies if the next operation is a receive (high) or transmit (low). 0: Transmit 1: Receive

register.name: MSTAT
register.description: I2C Master Control/Status This register accesses status bits when read and control bits when written. When read, the status register indicates the state of the I2C bus controller. When written, the control register configures the I2C controller operation. The START bit generates the START or REPEATED START condition. The STOP bit determines if the cycle stops at the end of the data cycle or continues on to a repeated START condition. To generate a single transmit cycle, the I2C Master Slave Address (I2CMSA) register is written with the desired address, the R/S bit is cleared, and this register is written with ACK=X (0 or 1), STOP=1, START=1, and RUN=1 to perform the operation and stop. When the operation is completed (or aborted due an error), an interrupt becomes active and the data may be read from the I2CMDR register. When the I2C module operates in Master receiver mode, the ACK bit is normally set, causing the I2C bus controller to transmit an acknowledge automatically after each byte. This bit must be cleared when the I2C bus controller requires no further data to be transmitted from the slave transmitter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: BUSBSY
field.description: Bus busy 0: The I2C bus is idle. 1: The I2C bus is busy. The bit changes based on the START and STOP conditions.

field.name: IDLE
field.description: I2C idle 0: The I2C controller is not idle. 1: The I2C controller is idle.

field.name: ARBLST
field.description: Arbitration lost 0: The I2C controller won arbitration. 1: The I2C controller lost arbitration.

field.name: DATACK
field.description: Acknowledge data 0: The transmited data was acknowledged. 1: The transmited data was not acknowledged.

field.name: ADRACK
field.description: Acknowledge address 0: The transmited address was acknowledged. 1: The transmited address was not acknowledged.

field.name: ERROR
field.description: Error 0: No error was detected on the last operation. 1: An error occurred on the last operation.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: I2C busy 0: The controller is idle. 1: The controller is busy. When the BUSY bit is set, the other status bits are not valid.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: ACK
field.description: Data acknowledge enable 0: The received data byte is not acknowledged automatically by the master. 1: The received data byte is acknowledged automatically by the master.

field.name: STOP
field.description: Generate STOP 0: The controller does not generate the STOP condition. 1: The controller generates the STOP condition.

field.name: START
field.description: Generate START 0: The controller does not generate the START condition. 1: The controller generates the START condition.

field.name: RUN
field.description: I2C master enable 0: The master is disabled. 1: The master is enabled to transmit or receive data. When the BUSY bit is set, the other status bits are not valid.

register.name: MDR
register.description: I2C Master Data This register contains the data to be transmitted when in the Master Transmit state and the data received when in the Master Receive state.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: DATA
field.description: When read: last RX Data is returned When Written: Data is transferred during TX transaction

register.name: MTPR
register.description: I2C Master Timer Period This register specifies the period of the SCL clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: TPR_7
field.description: Must be written to '0' to set the TPR field

field.name: TPR
field.description: SCL clock period This field specifies the period of the SCL clock. SCL_PRD = 2 * (1+TPR)*(SCL_LP + SCL_HP)*CLK_PRD where: SCL_PRD is the SCL line period (I2C clock). TPR is the timer period register value (range of 1 to 255) SCL_LP is the SCL low period (fixed at 6). SCL_HP is the SCL high period (fixed at 4). CLK_PRD is the system clock period in ns.

register.name: MIMR
register.description: I2C Master Interrupt Mask This register controls whether a raw interrupt is promoted to a controller interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: IM
field.description: Interrupt mask 1: The master interrupt is sent to the interrupt controller when the RIS bit in the I2CMRIS register is set. 0: The RIS interrupt is suppressed and not sent to the interrupt controller.

register.name: MRIS
register.description: I2C Master Raw Interrupt Status This register specifies whether an interrupt is pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: RIS
field.description: Raw interrupt status 1: A master interrupt is pending. 0: No interrupt This bit is cleared by writing 1 to the IC bit in the I2CMICR register.

register.name: MMIS
register.description: I2C Master Masked Interrupt Status This register specifies whether an interrupt was signaled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: MIS
field.description: Masked interrupt status 1: An unmasked master interrupt is pending. 0: An interrupt has not occurred or is masked. This bit is cleared by writing 1 to the IC bit in the I2CMICR register.

register.name: MICR
register.description: I2C Master Interrupt Clear This register clears the raw and masked interrupts.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: IC
field.description: Interrupt clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the RIS bit in the I2CMRIS register and the MIS bit in the I2CMMIS register. Reading this register returns no meaningful data.

register.name: MCR
register.description: I2C Master Configuration This register configures the mode (Master or Slave) and sets the interface for test mode loopback.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: RESERVED_RW
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: SFE
field.description: I2C slave function enable 1: Slave mode is enabled. 0: Slave mode is disabled.

field.name: MFE
field.description: I2C master function enable 1: Master mode is enabled. 0: Master mode is disabled.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

field.name: LPBK
field.description: I2C loopback 1: The controller in a test mode loopback configuration. 0: Normal operation

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Not used

field.name: STATUS
field.description: Status when reading: 1: Semaphore is available 0: Semaphore is taken Reading the register causes it to change value to 0. Releasing the semaphore is done by writing 1.

field.description: Not used

field.description: Register fill

field.name: AFULLTHR
field.description: Almost full threshold value in bits. This threshold affects the 'almostfull' and 'txready' status bits in MDMFIFOSTA. The FIFO can hold up to 64 bits.

field.name: AEMPTYTHR
field.description: Almost empty threshold in bits. This threshold affects the 'almostempty' and 'rxvalid' status bits in MDMFIFOSTA. The FIFO can hold up to 64 bits.

field.name: RESERVED6
field.description: Register fill

field.name: OVERFLOW
field.description: FIFO overflow error. If this flag is asserted the modem FIFO must be re-initialized to clear it. Note that re-initializing will flush the FIFO.

field.name: ALMOSTFULL
field.description: FIFO is almost full. Asserts when the FIFO fill level is above the almost full threshold.

field.name: ALMOSTEMPTY
field.description: FIFO is almost empty. Asserts when the FIFO fill level is below the almost empty threshold.

field.name: UNDERFLOW
field.description: FIFO underflow error. If this flag is asserted the modem FIFO must be re-initialized to clear it.

field.name: RXVALID
field.description: A full data word is valid and can be read in MDMRXFIFO register read port.

field.name: TXREADY
field.description: The MDMTXFIFO register write port is ready to receive a data word.

field.description: Counter = Counter + (IncUnit + 1)

field.name: RESERVED16
field.description: Register fill

field.name: PERIOD
field.description: Configurable 16 bit period that can be used for either the timer or the counter. In timer context; when timer value reach the timer period (i.e. it expires) a TIMER_IRQ event will occur; and the timer will restart from zero (until the timer is manually disabled). In counter context; a COUNTER_IRQ event will occur when the counter is equal to or higher than the period value.

field.description: 111/110/100/000. 'cmf'. Make appropriate bit 1 to force DCO's coarse/mid/fine wo SD.

field.name: TSTFORCESDCODE
field.description: 1 to force 8-bit code at input of DCO's SDM

field.name: SDMDLYDOUBLEEN
field.description: 1 doubles delay through sdm_dly_mat module. 0 is default single delay equal to bit 29 (sdm_dly_2or1z)

field.name: SDMDLYMATDIS
field.description: 1 to disable(reset) delay matching block that compensates for delay through SDM.

field.name: RESERVED29
field.description: Register fill

field.name: SDMDITHERMODE
field.description: How much dither to add on input in SDM.

field.name: SDMORDER1OR2Z
field.description: 1 to make SDM 1st order instead of default (0) 2nd order.

field.name: SDMDEMDIS
field.description: 1 to disable the SDM Dynamic Element Matching logic.

field.name: MPXCANDIS
field.description: 1 to disable mpx cancellation logic in Synth loop in TX mode.

field.name: SDMDIS
field.description: 1 to disable SDM (contribute 0 fine LSBs).

field.name: TSTDCOSDMOPREG
field.description: DCO's SD code to be forced in test mode and would take this value when synthreg05[0] is '1'

field.name: TSTFORCESDMOP
field.description: 1' selects tst_dco_sdm_op_reg instead of SDM 3-bit output

field.name: RETENTIONMODEEN
field.description: 1 to enable synth retention mode - the INL LUT is kept without being reset even if a tune sequence is executed.

field.name: SDMDLYMODE
field.description: Selects delay through integer portion of fine bits to match that with SD engine. 0=1-delay; 1=2-delay; 2=3-delay and 3=4-delay

field.description: Fractional value computed from the TDC data is compared against this value to select the REFCLK sampled on positive or negative edge of DCO clock. If the fractional value is less than edgesel_tdc_th1 or greater than edgesel_tdc_th2 ; it means that the REF (...)

field.name: EDGESELTDCTH1
field.description: Fractional value computed from the TDC data is compared against this value to select the REFCLK sampled on positive or negative edge of DCO clock. If the fractional value is less than edgesel_tdc_th1 or greater than edgesel_tdc_th2 ; it means that the REF (...)

field.description: This bit has to be toggled if the coefficients has to be changed on-the-fly

field.name: IIRFILTBW
field.description: BW for IIR filter. 00; 01; 10; 11 give K=2; 4; 8 and 16

field.name: IIRFILTERORDER
field.description: 1' is 2nd order; '0' is 1st order. Should go with iir_en

field.name: IIRFILTEN
field.description: Enables IIR filter along with regular filter

field.name: ALPHAHIGHPREC
field.description: 1' sets the format for pll_alpha as <8.4u> else <12u>.To be used in case of very small alpha values where f3db is very small as compared to REFINT frequency

field.name: PLLBETA
field.description: 2*pi* f3db/KDCO <14u>

field.name: PLLALPHA
field.description: pi^2 * f3db^2 * TREF /(KDCO*DF^2); where DF is the damping factor <12u> or <8.4u>

field.name: RESERVED24
field.description: Register fill

field.name: DELAYRETIMERINP
field.description: Delays generation of REFCLK_RETIMED_CLK by:

field.name: RECENTERDISABLE
field.description: Recentering is diabled then intrrupt won't be given

field.name: RECENTERTHRESHHOLD
field.description: If phase error is greater than this threshold for 128 consequtive times; recentering would happen. Current implementation sends out intrrupt to CM0 for further action and keep continuing in the PLL mode

field.name: PLLHWFINECALIBEN
field.description: Frequencey is calculated from PLL HW instead of old fb_cntr hw. '0' selects the old hw

field.name: CKVD64LATENCYFORMPXCAN
field.description: Latency of ckvd64 clock to delay can signal to match add path

field.name: CKVD16LATENCYFORMPXCAN
field.description: Latency of ckvd16 clock to delay can signal to match add path

field.name: REFCLKLATCHEDGESEL
field.description: 0 The retimed refclk from the analog is latched with the positive edge of DCOBY8 clock in the digigal 1: negative edge is used.

field.description: Register fill

field.name: TDCSATENABLE
field.description: 1 enables the saturation of fractional value based on the TDC data to 1

field.name: RESERVED_1

field.description: Major version number

field.name: HW_MINOR_VERSION
field.description: Minor version number

field.name: HW_PATCH_LEVEL
field.description: Patch level, starts at 0 at first delivery of this version.

field.name: EIP_NUMBER_COMPL
field.description: Bit-by-bit complement of the EIP_NUMBER field bits.

field.name: EIP_NUMBER
field.description: Binary encoding of the EIP-number of this DMA Controller (209)

field.name: KEY2
field.description: AES_KEY2[31+x:0+x] / AES_GHASH_H[31+x:0+x], where x = 0, 32, 64, 96 ordered from the LSW entry of this 4-deep register arrary. The interpretation of this field depends on the crypto operation mode. TDB - Check the Reference Manual

field.name: KEY3
field.description: AES_KEY3[31+x:0+x] / AES_KEY2[159+x:128+x], where x = 0, 32, 64, 96 ordered from the LSW entry of this 4-deep register arrary. The interpretation of this field depends on the crypto operation mode. TDB - Check the Reference Manual

field.name: IV
field.description: The interpretation of this field depends on the crypto operation mode. TDB - Check the Reference Manual

register.name: AES_CTRL
register.description: AES Input/Output Buffer Control and Mode register

field.name: CONTEXT_READY
field.description: If 1, this read-only status bit indicates that the context data registers can be overwritten and the Host is permitted to write the next context (note 2).

field.name: SAVED_CONTEXT_READY
field.description: (note 1) If 1, this status bit indicates that an AES authentication TAG and/or IV block(s) is/are available for the Host to retrieve. This bit is only asserted if the save_context bit is set to 1. The bit is mutual exclusive with the context_ready bit. Writing a one clears the bit to zero, indicating the AES core can start its next operation. This bit is also cleared when the 4th word of the output TAG and/or IV is read. Note: All other mode bit writes will be ignored when this mode bit is written with a one. Note: This bit is controlled automatically by the EIP-120t for TAG read DMA operations.

field.name: SAVE_CONTEXT
field.description: This bit indicates that an authentication TAG or result IV needs to be stored as a result context. Typically this bit must be set for authentication modes returning a TAG (CBC-MAC, GCM and CCM), or for basic encryption modes that require future continuation with the current result IV. If this bit is set, the engine will retain its full context until the TAG and/or IV registers are read. The TAG or IV must be read before the AES engine can start a new operation.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: CCM_M
field.description: Defines M that indicates the length of the authentication field for CCM operations; the authentication field length equals two times (the value of CCM-M plus one). Note: The EIP-120t always returns a 128-bit authentication field, of which the M least significant bytes are valid. All values are supported.

field.name: CCM_L
field.description: Defines L that indicates the width of the length field for CCM operations; the length field in bytes equals the value of CMM-L plus one. All values are supported.

field.name: CCM
field.description: If set to 1, AES-CCM is selected AES-CCM is a combined mode, using AES for both authentication and encryption. Note: Selecting AES-CCM mode requires writing of the AAD length register after all other registers. Note: The CTR mode bit in this register must also be set to 1 to enable AES-CTR; selecting other AES modes than CTR mode is invalid.

field.name: GCM
field.description: Set these bits to 11, to select AES-GCM mode. AES-GCM is a combined mode, using the Galois field multiplier GF(2128) for authentication and AES-CTR mode for encryption. Note: The CTR mode bit in this register must also be set to 1 to enable AES-CTR Bit combination description: 00 = no GCM mode 01 = reserved, do not select 10 = reserved, do not select 11 = autonomous GHASH (both H and Y0-encrypted calculated internally) Note: The EIP-120t-1 configuration only supports mode 11 (autonomous GHASH), other GCM modes are not allowed. So for the EIP-120t-1 configuration the only valid values are 00 and 11. Note: The EIP-120t-2 configuration does not support GCM and therefore these bits should always be set to 00.

field.name: CBC_MAC
field.description: Set to 1 to select AES-CBC MAC mode. The direction bit must be set to 1 for this mode. Selecting this mode requires writing the length register after all other registers.

field.name: RESERVED_0
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: CTR_WIDTH
field.description: Specifies the counter width for AES-CTR mode 00 = 32-bit counter 01 = 64-bit counter 10 = 96-bit counter 11 = 128-bit counter

field.name: CTR
field.description: If set to 1, AES counter mode (CTR) is selected. Note: This bit must also be set for GCM and CCM, when encryption/decryption is required.

field.name: CBC
field.description: If set to 1, cipher-block-chaining (CBC) mode is selected.

field.name: KEY_SIZE
field.description: This read-only field specifies the key size. The key size is automatically configured when a new key is loaded via the key store module. 00 = N/A - reserved 01 = 128-bit 10 = 192-bit 11 = 256-bit Refer to section 4.7 for details on the AES key, key size section and loading.

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: If set to 1 an encrypt operation is performed. If set to 0 a decrypt operation is performed. This bit must be written with a 1 when CBC-MAC is selected.

field.name: INPUT_READY
field.description: (note 1) If 1, this status bit indicates that the 16-byte AES input buffer is empty. The Host is permitted to write the next block of data. Writing a one clears the bit to zero and indicates that the AES core can use the provided input data block. Writing a 1 to this bit will be ignored. Note: For DMA operations, this bit is automatically controlled by the EIP-120t. After reset, this bit is 0. After writing a context (note 1), this bit will become 1.

field.name: OUTPUT_READY
field.description: (note 1) If 1, this status bit indicates that an AES output block is available to be retrieved by the Host. Writing a 0 clears the bit to zero and indicates that output data is read by the Host. The AES core can provide a next output data block. Writing a 1 to this bit will be ignored. Note: For DMA operations, this bit is automatically controlled by the EIP-120t.

field.name: C_LENGTH
field.description: Bits [31:0] of the combined data length register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: C_LENGTH
field.description:
Bits [60:32] of the combined data length register.
Bits [60:0] of the crypto length registers (LSW and MSW) store the cryptographic data length in bytes for all modes. Once processing with this context is started, this length decrements to zero. Data lengths up to (2^61 - 1) bytes are allowed. For GCM, any value up to 2^36 - 32 bytes can be used. This is because a 32-bit counter mode is used; the maximum number of 128-bit blocks is 2^32 - 2, resulting in a maximum number of bytes of 2^36 - 32. Writing to this register triggers the engine to start using this context. This is valid for all modes except GCM and CCM. Note: For the combined modes (GCM and CCM), this length does not include the authentication only data; the authentication length is specified in the AES_AUTH_LENGTH register below. All modes must have a length > 0. For the combined modes, it is allowed to have one of the lengths equal to zero. For the basic encryption modes (ECB/CBC/CTR) it is allowed to program zero to the length field; in that case the length is assumed infinite. All data must be byte (8-bit) aligned for stream cipher modes; bit aligned data streams are not supported by the EIP-120t. For block cipher modes, the data length must be programmed in multiples of the block cipher size, 16 bytes. For a Host read operation, these registers return all-zeroes.

field.name: AUTH_LENGTH
field.description: Bits [31:0] of the authentication length register store the authentication data length in bytes for combined modes only (GCM or CCM) Supported AAD-lengths for CCM are from 0 to (2^16 - 2^8) bytes. For GCM any value up to (2^32 - 1) bytes can be used. Once processing with this context is started, this length decrements to zero. Writing this register triggers the engine to start using this context for GCM and CCM. For a Host read operation, these registers return all-zeroes.

field.name: DATA
field.description:
Data registers for output block data from the EIP-120t. - AES_DATA_OUT_0 = AES Output Data[31:0] - AES_DATA_OUT_1 = AES Output Data[63:32] - AES_DATA_OUT_2 = AES Output Data[95:64] - AES_DATA_OUT_3 = AES Output Data[127:96] For normal operations, this register is not used, since data input and output is transferred from and to the AES core via DMA.
For a Host read operation, these registers contain the 128-bit output block from the latest AES operation. Reading from a word-aligned offset within this address range will read one word (4 bytes) of data out the 4-word deep (16 bytes = 128-bits AES block) data output buffer. The words (4 words, one full block) should be read before the core will move the next block to the data output buffer. To empty the data output buffer, the output_ready flag of the AES_CTRL register must be written. For the modes with authentication (CBC-MAC, GCM and CCM), the invalid (message) bytes/words can be written with any data.
Note: The AAD / authentication only data is not copied to the output buffer but only used for authentication.

field.name: DATA
field.description:
Data registers for input block data to the EIP-120t. - AES_DATA_IN_0 = AES Input Data[31:0] - AES_DATA_IN_1 = AES Input Data[63:32] - AES_DATA_IN_2 = AES Input Data[95:64] - AES_DATA_IN_3 = AES Input Data[127:96] For normal operations, this register is not used, since data input and output is transferred from and to the AES core via DMA.
For a Host write operation, these registers must be written with the 128-bit input block for the next AES operation. Writing at a word-aligned offset within this address range will store the word (4 bytes) of data into the corresponding position of 4-word deep (16 bytes = 128-bit AES block) data input buffer. This buffer is used for the next AES operation. If the last data block is not completely filled with valid data (see notes below), it is allowed to write only the words with valid data. Next AES operation is triggered by writing to the input_ready flag of the AES_CTRL register.
Note: AES typically operates on 128 bits block multiple input data. The CTR, GCM and CCM modes form an exception. The last block of a CTR-mode message may contain less than 128 bits (refer to [NIST 800-38A]): 0 < n <= 128 bits. For GCM/CCM, the last block of both AAD and message data may contain less than 128 bits (refer to [NIST 800-38D]). The EIP-120t automatically pads or masks misaligned ending data blocks with zeroes for GCM, CCM and CBC-MAC. For CTR mode, the remaining data in an unaligned data block is ignored.

field.name: AES_TAG
field.description: This register contains the authentication TAG for the combined and authentication-only modes.

field.name: TYPE
field.description: This field reads 0x01 for the EIP-120t-1 device This field reads 0x02 for the EIP-120t-2 device

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: ANH_INTERFACE
field.description: AHB interface is available If this bit is zero, the EIP-120t has a TCM interface

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: SHA_256
field.description: The HASH core supports SHA-256

field.name: AEC_CCM
field.description: AES-CCM is available as a single operation

field.name: AEC_GCM
field.description: AES-GCM is available as a single operation

field.name: AES_256
field.description: AES core supports 256-bit keys Note: If both AES-128 and AES-256 are set to one, the AES core supports 192-bit keys as well.

field.name: AES_128
field.description: AES core supports 128-bit keys

field.name: RESERVED_0
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: HASH
field.description: HASH Core is available

field.name: AES
field.description: AES core is available

field.name: KEY_STORE
field.description: KEY STORE is available

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: HW_MAJOR_VERSION
field.description: Major version number

field.name: HW_MINOR_VERSION
field.description: Minor version number

field.name: HW_PATCH_LEVEL
field.description: Patch level, starts at 0 at first delivery of this version.

field.name: EIP_NUMBER_COMPL
field.description: These bits simply contain the complement of bits [7:0] (0x87), used by a driver to ascertain that the EIP-120t register is indeed read.

field.name: EIP_NUMBER
field.description: These bits encode the EIP number for the EIP-120t, this field contains the value 120 (decimal) or 0x78.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Channel external address value. When read during operation, it holds the last updated external address after being sent to the master interface.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PORT_ERR
field.description: Reflects possible transfer errors on the AHB port.

field.name: RESERVED_0
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: CH1_ACT
field.description: A 1 indicates that channel 1 is active (DMA transfer on-going).

field.name: CH0_ACT
field.description: A 1 indicates that channel 0 is active (DMA transfer on-going).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: DMALEN
field.description: Channel DMA length in bytes. During configuration, this register contains the DMA transfer length in bytes. During operation, it contains the last updated value of the DMA transfer length after being sent to the master interface. Note: Setting this register to a non-zero value starts the transfer if the channel is enabled. Therefore, this register must be written last when setting up a DMA channel!

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Channel external address value. When read during operation, it holds the last updated external address after being sent to the master interface.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PRIO
field.description: Channel priority: 0 - Low 1 - High If both channels have the same priority, access of the channels to the external port is arbitrated using the Round Robin scheme. If one channel has a High priority and another one Low, the channel with the High priority is served first, in case of simultaneous access requests.

field.name: EN
field.description: Channel enable: 0 - Disabled 1 - Enable Note: Disabling an active channel will interrupt the DMA operation. The ongoing block transfer will be completed, but no new transfers will be requested.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PRIO
field.description: Channel priority: 0 - Low 1 - High If both channels have the same priority, access of the channels to the external port is arbitrated using the Round Robin scheme. If one channel has a High priority and another one Low, the channel with the High priority is served first, in case of simultaneous access requests.

field.name: EN
field.description: Channel enable: 0 - Disabled 1 - Enable Note: Disabling an active channel will interrupt the DMA operation. The ongoing block transfer will be completed, but no new transfers will be requested.

field.name: RESERVED_2
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PORT1_AHB_ERROR
field.description: A 1 indicates that the EIP-101m has detected an AHB bus error

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PORT1_CHANNEL
field.description: Indicates which channel has serviced last (channel 0 or channel 1) by AHB master port.

field.name: RESERVED_0
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.description: Channel DMA length in bytes. During configuration, this register contains the DMA transfer length in bytes. During operation, it contains the last updated value of the DMA transfer length after being sent to the master interface. Note: Setting this register to a non-zero value starts the transfer if the channel is enabled. Therefore, this register must be written last when setting up a DMA channel!

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: SWRES
field.description: Software reset enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled (self-cleared to zero). Note: Completion of the software reset must be checked via the DMAC_STATUS register.

field.name: RESERVED_1
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: AHB_MST1_BURST_SIZE
field.description: Maximum burst size that can be performed on the AHB bus 0010b = 4 bytes (default) 0011b = 8 bytes 0100b = 16 bytes 0101b = 32 bytes 0110b = 64 bytes Others = reserved

field.name: AHB_MST1_IDLE_EN
field.description: Idle insertion between consecutive burst transfers on AHB 0 - No Idle insertion 1 - Idle insertion

field.name: AHB_MST1_INCR_EN
field.description: Burst length type of AHB transfer 0 - unspecified length burst transfers 1 - fixed length burst or single transfers

field.name: AHB_MST1_LOCK_EN
field.description: Locked transform on AHB 0 - transfers are not locked 1 - transfers are locked

field.name: AHB_MST1_BIGEND
field.description: Endianess for the AHB master 0 - little endian 1 - big endian

field.name: RESERVED_0
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: LEVEL
field.description: If this bit is zero, the interrupt output is a pulse If this bit is set to one, the interrupt is a level interrupt that must be cleared by writing the interrupt clear register This bit is applicable for both interrupt output signals.

field.name: DMA_BUS_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the DMA bus error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: KEY_ST_WR_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the key store write error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: KEY_ST_RD_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the key store read error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: DMA_IN_DONE
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the DMA in done (irq_dma_in_done) interrupt output is cleared, writing a zero has no effect. Note that clearing an interrupt only makes sense if the interrupt output is programmed as level (refer to CTRL_INT_CFG)

field.name: RESULT_AV
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the result available (irq_result_av) interrupt output is cleared, writing a zero has no effect. Note that clearing an interrupt only makes sense if the interrupt output is programmed as level (refer to CTRL_INT_CFG)

field.name: DMA_BUS_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the DMA bus error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: KEY_ST_WR_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the key store write error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: KEY_ST_RD_ERR
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the key store read error status is cleared, writing a zero has no effect.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: DMA_IN_DONE
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the DMA data in done (irq_dma_in_done) interrupt output is set to one, writing a zero has no effect. If the interrupt configuration register is programmed to pulse, clearing the DMA data in done (irq_dma_in_done) interrupt is not needed. If it is programmed to level, clearing the interrupt output should be done by writing the interrupt clear register (CTRL_INT_CLR)

field.name: RESULT_AV
field.description: If a one is written to this bit, the result available (irq_result_av) interrupt output is set to one, writing a zero has no effect. If the interrupt configuration register is programmed to pulse, clearing the result available (irq_result_av) interrupt is not needed. If it is programmed to level, clearing the interrupt output should be done by writing the interrupt clear register (CTRL_INT_CLR)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: DMA_IN_DONE
field.description: If this bit is set to zero the DMA input done (irq_dma_in_done) interrupt output is disabled and will remain zero If this bit is set to one, the DMA input done interrupt output is enabled

field.name: RESULT_AV
field.description: If this bit is set to zero the result available (irq_result_av) interrupt output is disabled and will remain zero If this bit is set to one, the result available interrupt output is enabled

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: SW_RESET
field.description: If this bit is set to 1, the following modules are reset: - Master control internal state is reset. That includes interrupt, error status register and result available interrupt generation FSM. - Key store module state is reset. That includes clearing the Written Area flags; therefore the keys must be reloaded to the key store module. Writing 0 has no effect. The bit is self cleared after executing the reset.

field.name: TAG
field.description: If this bit is cleared to zero, the DMA operation involves only data. If this bit is set, the DMA operation includes a TAG (Authentication Result / Digest). For SHA-256 operation, a DMA must be set up for both input data and TAG. For any other selected module, setting this bit only allows a DMA that reads the TAG. No data allowed to be transferred to or from the selected module via the DMA.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: AES
field.description: If set to one, selects the AES engine as source/destination for the DMA Both Read and Write maximum transfer size to DMA engine is set to 16 bytes

field.name: KEY_STORE
field.description: If set to one, selects the Key Store as destination for the DMA The maximum transfer size to DMA engine is set to 32 bytes (however transfers of 16, 24 and 32 bytes are allowed)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: PROT_EN
field.description: If this bit is cleared to zero m_h_prot[1] on the AHB master interface always remains zero. If this bit is set to one, the m_h_prot[1] signal on the master AHB bus is asserted to 1 if a AHB read operation is performed, using DMA, with the key store module as destination.

field.name: DMA_BUS_ERR
field.description: This bit is set when a DMA bus error is detected during a DMA operation. The value of this register is held until it is cleared via the CTRL_INT_CLR register. Note: This error is asserted if an error is detected on the AHB master interface during a DMA operation.

field.name: KEY_ST_WR_ERR
field.description: This bit is set when a write error is detected during the DMA write operation to the key store memory. The value of this register is held until it is cleared via the CTRL_INT_CLR register. Note: This error is asserted if a DMA operation does not cover a full key area or more areas are written than expected.

field.name: KEY_ST_RD_ERR
field.description: This bit will be set when a read error is detected during the read of a key from the key store, while copying it to the AES core. The value of this register is held until it is cleared via the CTRL_INT_CLR register. Note: This error is asserted if a key location is selected in the key store that is not available.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: DMA_IN_DONE
field.description: This read only bit returns the actual DMA data in done (irq_data_in_done) interrupt status of the DMA data in done interrupt output pin (irq_data_in_done).

field.name: RESULT_AV
field.description: This read only bit returns the actual result available (irq_result_av) interrupt status of the result available interrupt output pin (irq_result_av).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: KEY_SIZE
field.description: Key size: 00 - Reserved 01 - 128 bits 10 - 192 bits 11 - 256 bits When writing this to this register, KEY_STORE_WRITTEN_AREA register will be reset. Note: For the EIP-120t-2 configuration the key_size bits are fixed to 01, for software compatibility the KEY_STORE_WRITTEN_AREA register will still be reset when writing to this register.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Key store operation busy status flag (read only): 0 -operation is completed. 1 -operation is not completed and the key store is busy.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: RAM_AREA
field.description: Selects the area of the key store RAM from where the key needs to be read that will be writen to the AES engine. ram_area: 0000 - ram_area0 0001 - ram_area1 0010 - ram_area2 0011 - ram_area3 0100 - ram_area4 0101 - ram_area5 0110 - ram_area6 0111 - ram_area7 1000 - no ram area selected 1001 .. 1111 - Reserved RAM areas ram_area0, ram_area2, ram_area4 and ram_area6 are the only valid read areas for 192 and 256 bits key sizes. Only RAM areas that contain valid written keys can be selected.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN7
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN6
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN5
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN4
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN3
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN2
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN1
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RAM_AREA_WRITTEN0
field.description: ram_area_writtenx (read) : 0 - This RAM area is not written with valid key information. 1 - This RAM area is written with valid key information. Each individual ram_area_writtenx bit can be reset by writing a 1. Note: This register will be reset on a soft reset from the master control module. After a soft reset, all keys must be rewritten to the key store memory.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Write zeroes and ignore on reading

field.name: RAM_AREA7
field.description: Represents an area of 128 bits. Select the key store RAM area(s) where the key(s) needs to be written. ram_areax: 0 - ram_areax is not selected to be written. 1 - ram_areax is selected to be written. Writing to multiple RAM locations is only possible when the selected RAM areas are sequential.

register.name: AONEVFLAG
register.description: Event flags for events to AON

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: FLAGS
field.description: Event flags for the AON events. Writing a '1' to one of these flags have no effect, writing a zero to a flag clears it, and at the same time sets the corresponding event line to AON low. Reading will return the even flags.

register.name: AONEVPOL
register.description: Polarity of the events generating events to AON

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: POL
field.description: These bits are xor'ed with the actual event lines. 0: Rising edge sets the corresonding flag and asserts the event line. 1: Falling edge sets the corresponding flag and asserts the event line.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: REQMODE
field.description: 0: AUX generates events on DMA_Req_o 1: AUX generates events on DMA_Sreq_o

field.name: EN
field.description: 0: DMA interface is not in use 1: DMA interface is active

field.name: SEL
field.description: 0: ADC fifo not empty generates DMA event 1: ADC almost full generates DMA event

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RC2CL
field.description: Writing 1 to this bit sets the corresponding event line (#2). Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. To read the status of the event line, read AONEVFLAG

field.name: ERR
field.description: Writing 1 to this bit sets the corresponding event line (#1). Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. To read the status of the event line, read AONEVFLAG

field.name: SM
field.description: Writing 1 to this bit sets the corresponding event line (#0). Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. To read the status of the event line, read AONEVFLAG

field.description: Reserved

field.name: POL

field.description: For each bit in this field 0: The corresponding event will not generate an event on the combined output 1: The corresponding event will set the combined event output if the corresponding flag is set to 1

field.description: Reading this register will at the same time clear the register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EVENTRELEASE
field.description:
This register is meant for AUX controller usage only. It can be accessed from OCP as well for debug and verification purposes.
Writing to this register will release the corresponding semaphore to the event line to AUX_ctrl as soon as it is ready.
Write same value again to set the event line low. Alternatively, the event line will be automatically cleared when semaphore is returned..
When read the last written value is returned

register.name: MODCLKEN
register.description: Clock enable for submodules of AUX

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: AUX_ADI
field.description: Clock for ADI Master 0: AUX_ADI clock is stopped 1: AUX_ADI clock is running NOTE: The OSCTRL also has to be enabled in order to use the ADI master

field.name: OSCCTRL
field.description: Clock for DDI Master 0: OSC_CTRL clock is stopped 1: OSC_CTRL clock is running

field.name: TDCIF
field.description: 0: TDCIF clock is stopped 1: TDCIF clock is running

field.name: SOC_AUXCTRL
field.description: 0: SOC_AUXCTRL clock is stopped 1: SOC_AUXCTRL clock is running

field.name: TIMER

field.name: AIODIOCTRL0
field.description: 0: AIODIOCTRL0 clock is stopped 1: AIODIOCTRL0 clock is running

field.name: SMPH
field.description: 0: SMPH clock is stopped 1: SMPH clock is running

field.description: Reserved

field.name: REQ
field.description: 0: Request to be powered 1: Request to be powered off The request will only be made if AUXCTRLSTAT.FON = 0 and ICBSTAT.IDLE=1

field.name: RESERVED

field.name: REQ
field.description: 0: Request to be in active mode 1: Request to be in power down mode

field.name: ACK
field.description: 0: The AUX can assume that it is in active mode 1: The request for power down is acknowledted and the AUX must act like it is in power down mode

field.name: REQ
field.description: 0: Request high frequency clock 1: Request low frequency clock

field.name: ACK
field.description: 0: Ack of high frequency clock 1: Ack of low frequency clock

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: REQ

field.name: RESERVED

field.name: READY
field.description: 0: Global bias is not ready 1: Global bias is ready

field.name: RESERVED

field.name: REQ

field.name: RESERVED

field.name: READY
field.description: 0: Band gap is not ready 1: Band gap is ready

field.description: Reserved

field.name: LATCH_EN
field.description: Controls latches in AON_IOC. For AIODIO settings to have effect on pads, the latches needs to be closed if one wants to preserve settings during power off of aux. 0: Latch closed 1: Latch open

register.name: DEFAULTALIAS
register.description: Reserved for default address in alias table

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: START_POL
field.description: 0: Start on rising edge of event line 1: Start on falling edge of event line

field.name: START_SRC
field.description:
Select source of the ADC start signal.
0: AON_WU_EVENT 1: CMP_A_i 2: CMP_B_i 3: TDC_Done 4: Timer 0 event 5: Timer 1 event 6: Reserved 7: ADC_Done 8: ADC_Almost_full 9:12: None 13:28 AIO_DAT_i [0:15] 29: ACLK_Ref_i 30: MCU_Event_i 31: ADC_irq

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CTRL
field.description: 00: ADC Interface disabled 01: ADC Interface enabled 10: Reserved 11: ADC Fifo Flush. Note that CTRL needs to be set to 01 again for fifo to be functional. A flush takes a couple of clock periods on the AUX clock to finish.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: OVERFLOW
field.description: 0: Fifo has not overflowed 1: Fifo has overflowed, this flag is sticky until fifo is flushed

field.name: UNDERFLOW
field.description: 0: Fifo has not underflowed 1: Fifo has underflowed, this flag is sticky until the fifo is flushed

field.name: FULL
field.description: 0: Fifo is not full 1: Fifo is full

field.name: ALMOST_FULL
field.description: 0: Fifo is not almost full 1: There is room for one more sample in the fifo

field.name: EMPTY
field.description: 0: There is data in the fifo 1: The fifo is empty

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DATA
field.description: When read a sample is popped from the fifo. When written the written data is put in the fifo

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TRIG
field.description: A write to this register will trigger an ADC conversion. If the corresponding event selected to trigger conversions in ADCCTRL.START_SRC and ADCCTRL.START_POL is active, a write will not generate a trigger. To be sure that all writes generate triggers one should set the ADCCTRL.START_SRC and ADCCTRL.START_POL to a setting that does not trigger conversion from the event lines. (E.g set it to a unused comparator)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.description: Reserved

field.name: T1PRE
field.description: Prescaler division ratio n: Division ratio is 2^n

field.name: T0PRE
field.description: Prescaler division ratio n: Division ratio is 2^n

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: T1MODE
field.description: 0: Timer 1 increments on each clock cycle 1: Timer 1 counter increments only on edges of the event set by T1TICKSRC ( note that events are only sampled according to prescaler setting, every 2^T1PRE clock cycles )

field.name: T1RELOAD
field.description: 0: Timer 1 is not automatically restarted 1:Timer 1 is automatically restarted when target is reached

field.name: T0MODE
field.description: 0: Timer 0 increments on each clock cycle 1: Timer 0 counter increments only on edges of the event set by T0TICKSRC ( note that events are only sampled according to prescaler setting every 2^T0PRE clock cycles )

field.name: T0RELOAD
field.description: 0: Timer 0 is not automatically restarted 1:Timer 0 is automatically restarted when target is reached

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SRC_POL1
field.description: 0: count rising edges 1: Count falling edges

field.name: T1TICKSRC
field.description: Aux timer 1 tick source. Select which event line shall be used as tick source for timer 1

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SRC_POL0
field.description: 0: count rising edges 1: Count falling edges

field.name: T0TICKSRC
field.description: Aux timer 0 tick source. Select which event line shall be used as tick source for timer 0

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: STOP1
field.description: Write 1 to stop timer 1 Note: START1 takes precedence over STOP1

field.name: STOP0
field.description: Write 1 to stop timer 0 Note: START0 takes precedence over STOP0

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: START1
field.description: Write 1 to start timer 1. When read returns 1 if timer is running. 0 Otherwise

field.name: START0
field.description: Write 1 to start timer 0. When read returns 1 if timer is running. 0 Otherwise

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: T0TARGET
field.description:
Aux timer 0 counts from 0 to T0TARGET. Then gives an event and restarts if configured to do to so in the CFG0.T0RELOAD setting
If T0MODE=0,no prescaler is used, and T0TARGET equals 1, the event line will be always set

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: T1TARGET
field.description:
Aux timer 1 counts from 0 to T1TARGET. Then gives an event and restarts if configured to do to so in the CFG0.T1RELOAD setting
If T1MODE=0,no prescaler is used, and T1TARGET equals 1, the event line will be always set

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CTRL
field.description: Command for starting TDC measurement

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: STARTBF
field.description: Internal signal for debug purpose 1: Start signal was received before falling edge of fast clock 0: Start signal was received after falling edge of fast clock

field.name: STOPAF
field.description: Internal signal for debug purpose 1: Stop signal was received after falling edge of fast_clock 0: Stop signal was received before falling edge of fast _clock

field.name: SAT
field.description: 1Conversion stopped due to timeout

field.name: DONE
field.description: 1: Measurement complete

field.name: STATE
field.description: Readback of TDC statemachine

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DAT
field.description: Result of the TDC conversion

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: LIMIT
field.description: Select when the TDC should time out. 0<=n<4 : Time out when TDCRES.DAT[10+3] is high 4<=n<15: Time out when TDCRES.DAT[10+n] is high. 15: Time out when TDCRES.DAT wraps around

register.name: TDCSTRIGSRC
register.description: Select start/stop trigger sources for TDC

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: STOP_POL
field.description:
Select polarity of stop signal. 0: Stops when high level is detected 1: Stops when low level is detected
NB must not be changed if STATE is not IDLE

field.name: STOP_SRC
field.description: Selects event for asyncronous stop NB must not be changed if STATE is not IDLE 0: AON_WU_EVENT 1: CMP_A_i 2: CMP_B_i 3: CS_RESET_n 4: Timer 0 event 5: Timer 1 event 6: Reserved 7: ADC_Done 8: ADC_almost_full 9:12: Obssigs[3:0] 13:28 AIO_DAT_i [0:15] 29: ACLK_Ref_i 30: MCU_Event_i 31: TDC_prescaler

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: START_POL
field.description:
Select polarity of start signal. 0: Starts when high level is detected 1: Starts when low level is detected
NB must not be changed if STATE is not IDLE

field.name: START_SRC
field.description: Selects event for asyncronous start 0: AON_WU_EVENT 1: CMP_A_i 2: CMP_B_i 3: CS_RESET_n 4: Timer 0 event 5: Timer 1 event 6: Reserved 7: ADC_Done 8: ADC_almost_full 9:12: Obssigs[3:0] 13:28 AIO_DAT_i [0:15] 29: ACLK_Ref_i 30: MCU_Event_i 31: TDC_prescaler

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CNT
field.description:
Remaining #stop events that will be ignored. Writing to this register updates the value.
NB must not be changed if state is not IDLE

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SEI
field.description:
Counter compare value. When the counter is enabled the first #CMP-1 stop events is ignored. Ant the TDC will stop measurement on event #CMP
NB! Both values 0 and 1 will make the TDC stop on the first event after the start event
NB must not be changed if state is not IDLE

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EN
field.description: Counter 0: Counter is disabled 1: Counter is enabled When counter is enabled the first #CNT stop events are ignored. This can be used to measure multiple periods of a clock signal. NB must not be changed if state is not IDLE

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESET_N
field.description: Prescaler reset control 0: Prescaler is held in reset 1: Prescaler is not held in reset

field.name: RATIO
field.description: Prescaler ratio. 0: Prescaler divides by 16 1: Prescaler divides by 64

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SOURCE
field.description: Selects event for prescaler to use as input NB only change when prescaler is in reset 0: AON_WU_EVENT 1: CMP_A_i 2: CMP_B_i 3: CS_RESET_n 4: Timer 0 event 5: Timer 1 event 6: Reserved 7: ADC_Done_i 8:12: Obssigs[3:0] 13:28 AIO_DAT_i [0:15] 29: ACLK_Ref_i 30: MCU_Event_i 31: Prescaler stopped

field.name: FORCEEVLOW
field.description: 1: Force event signals low

field.name: FORCEEVHIGH
field.description: 1: Force event signals high (takes priority over FORCEEVLOW)

field.name: FORCEWAKEUPHIGH

field.name: RESTART

field.name: BUSERROR
field.description:
This bit is set if the C3PO tries to access memory space where no peripheral is mapped. This bit is also set if the clock to a peripheral is stopped and C3PO tries to access it.
When this bit is set the C3POCTRL.SUSPEND is also set and the C3PO is suspended. To resume operation of the C3PO write C3POCTRL.SUSPEND = 0 and the bus error flag will be cleared as well

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DI_REQ
field.description: Read current value of DI_REQ signal. Writing 0 to this bit forces a sync with slave, ensuring that req will be 0. It is recommended to write 0 to this register before power down of the master.

field.name: DI_ACK
field.description: Read current value of DI_ACK signal

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESETLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESET
field.description: Write 1 to reset the DDI slave

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CONFLOCK
field.description: This register is no longer accessible when this bit is set. (unless sticky_bit_overwrite is asserted on top module)

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: WAITFORACK
field.description: A transaction does not end on the DDI interface until ack has been received when this bit is set.

field.name: DDICLKSPEED
field.description: Sets the period of an DDI transactions. All transactions takes an even number of clock cycles,- DDI clock rising edge occurs in the middle of the period. Data and ctrl to slave is set up in beginning of cycle, and data from slave is read in after the transaction 00: An DDI transaction takes 2 master clock cyclkes 01: An DDI transaction takes 4 master clock cycles 10: And DDI Transaction takes 8 master clock cycles 11: An DDI transaction takes 16 master clock cycles
