peripheral.name: RFCORERAM
peripheral.description: Dummy Component for CC26xx memory map template

peripheral.name: FLASH_CFG
peripheral.description: Dummy Component for CC26xx memory map template

field.name: CALCULATION
field.description: 0: Calculation block disabled 1: Calculation block enabled

field.name: MEASUREMENT
field.description: 0: Measurements disabled 1: Measurements are performed(battery voltage and temperature)

field.name: CFG
field.description: 11: Measure every 32 cycle 10: Measure every 16 cycle 01: Measure every 8 cycle 00: Measure continuously

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: 1: Testing of comparator possible.

register.name: TEMPP0
register.description: Temperature calculation parameter 0. Sets the constant term in the selector vaule – to – temperature value quadratic equation.

field.name: CFG
field.description:
The configuration value will be mapped before used in temperature calculation. The values below reflect the mapped end value.
bit 7: Select range 0: range -384 - -257 1: range -256 - -129
bit [6:0]: offset from range base (-384 or -256)

register.name: TEMPP1
register.description: Temperature calculation parameter 1. Sets the linear coefficient in the quadratic equation.

field.name: CFG
field.description:
The configuration value will be mapped before used in temperature calculation. The values below reflect the mapped end value.
bit [5:0]: offset from range base 256 with resolution of 4 (2 bits). Max value: 508

register.name: TEMPP2
register.description: Temperature calculation parameter 2. Sets the quadratic coefficient in the quadratic equation.

field.name: CFG
field.description:
The configuration value will be mapped before used in temperature calculation. The values below reflect the mapped value.
bit [4:0]: offset from range base 64 with resolution of 2 (1 bit). Max value: 126

register.name: BMONP0
register.description: Battery voltage calculation parameter 0. Sets the linear coefficient in the linear equation for selector value – to – battery voltage conversion.

field.name: CFG
field.description:
The configuration value will be mapped before used in voltage calculation. The values below reflect the mapped end value.
bit 5: Select range 0: range 352 - 383 1: range 384 - 415
bit [4:0]: offset from range base (352 or 384)

register.name: BMONP1
register.description: Battery voltage calculation parameter 1. Sets the constant term in the linear equation.

field.name: CFG
field.description:
The configuration value will be mapped before used in voltage calculation. The values below reflect the mapped value.
bit [5:0]: offset from range base 128. Max value: 191

field.name: CFG2
field.description: Configuration of second stage of the drive strength conversion

field.name: CFG1
field.description: Configuration of first stage of the drive strength conversion

field.name: OVERRIDE
field.description: 0: Override disabled 1: Override enabled and the 4 LSBs of this register is used towards flash pump.

field.name: HYSTERESIS
field.description: 0: 1 bit hysteresis between rising and falling voltage compare 1: 2 bit hysteresis between rising and falling voltage compare

field.name: CFG
field.description: Adjustmen of the voltage limits. All zeros use lowest limits, all ones configures highest limits.

field.name: INTEGER
field.description: Integer part

field.name: FRACTIONAL
field.description: Fractional part

field.name: STATUS
field.description: 1 if new battery voltage is present. Write '1' to clear the status.

field.name: INTEGER
field.description: Integer part (signed)

field.name: FRACTIONAL
field.description: Fractional part

field.name: STATUS
field.description: 1 if new temperature is present. Write '1' to clear the status.

field.name: STATUS
field.description: Comparator output in test mode

field.name: STATUS
field.description: IO drive strength sent towards the AON IOC (gray encoded)

register.name: VINAT
register.description: Voltage indication status register. Reflects status sent towards Flash Pump

field.name: VINAT3P0
field.description: 1: Indicates that the Voltage is above 3.0 Volts

field.name: VINAT2P4
field.description: 1: Indicates that the Voltage is above 2.4 Volts

field.name: VINAT2P1
field.description: 1: Indicates that the Voltage is above 2.1 Volts

field.name: VINAT1P7
field.description: 1: Indicates that the Voltage is above 1.7 Volts

field.name: STATUS
field.description: 0: SAR search not done yet 1: SAR search done

field.name: MIN
field.description: Gray encoded value to output on pad_STR0/1/2_o when mcu_ioc_STR_i selects minimum drive strength

field.name: MED
field.description: Gray encoded value to output on pad_STR0/1/2_o when mcu_ioc_STR_i selects medium drive strength

field.name: MAX
field.description: Gray encoded value to output on pad_STR0/1/2_o when mcu_ioc_STR_i selects maximum drive strength

register.name: IOCLATCH
register.description: Controls transparency of all latches holding I/O or configuration state from the MCU IOC

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: 0: Latches are static 1: Latches are transparent

field.name: OEN
field.description: 0: Output enable active 1: Output enable not active

field.name: WU3
field.description: Event source ID for MCU wake-up event 3

field.name: WU2
field.description: Event source ID for MCU wake-up event 2

field.name: WU1
field.description: Event source ID for MCU wake-up event 1

field.name: WU0
field.description: Event source ID for MCU wake-up event 0

field.name: WU2
field.description: Event source ID for AUX wake-up event 2

field.name: WU1
field.description: Event source ID for AUX wake-up event 1

field.name: WU0
field.description: Event source ID for AUX wake-up event 0

field.name: AONS2
field.description: Event source ID for MCU AONS event 2

field.name: AONS1
field.description: Event source ID for MCU AONS event 1

field.name: AONS0
field.description: Event source ID for MCU AONS event 0

field.name: AONS0
field.description: Event source ID for RTC AONS event 0

field.name: RES
field.description: Reserved

field.name: CALIBRATED
field.description: MCU bootcode will set this bit when the MCU_CLK HF is calibrated. The FLASH can not be used until this bit is set. 1: MCU clock is calibrated to 48 Mhz, allowing flash to power up. 0: Flash must not assume that the sclk_hf is safe

field.name: PDSRC
field.description: When MCU requests powerdown with sclk_hf as source, then WUC will switch over to this clock source during powerdown, and automatically switch back to sclk_hf when the system is back in active mode 00: no clock in pd 01: sclk_lf 10: sclk_mf 11: reserved

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: PDSRC
field.description: When AUX requests powerdown with sclk_hf as source, then WUC will switch over to this clock source during powerdown, and automatically switch back to sclk_hf when the system is back in active mode 00: no clock in pd 01: sclk_lf 10: sclk_mf 11: reserved

field.name: DIV
field.description: Select the AUX clock divider for hfclk 000: DIV 2 001: DIV 4 010: DIV 8 011: DIV 16 100: DIV 32 101: DIV 64 110: DIV 128 111: DIV 256 NB: It is not supported to change the aux clock divider while the hfclk is active

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SRC
field.description: Selects the clock source for AUX: 001: sclk_hf 010: sclk_mf 100: sclk_lf Others: reserved NB: Switching the clock source is guaranteed to be glitchless

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: VIRTOFF
field.description: Controls action when receiving a request to power-off MCU: 0: Power-off MCU 1: Assert reset and stop clock, but keep MCU powered (virtual power-off)

field.name: FIXEDWU
field.description: Controls timing of MCU-wakeup: 0: MCU wake-up is immediately following triggering event 1: MCU wake-up is forced to happen a fixed number of 32 KHz clocks following the triggering event. The number of 32 Khz clock cycles is configured in CONFIG.FIXEDWUPERIOD register This bit is used to ensure that the MCU is always woken up an exact number of clocks following the triggering event by compensating for any variable delays caused by other activities going on at the time of wakeup (such as a recharge event etc.)

field.name: RES3
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SRAMRET
field.description: MCU RAM is partitioned into 4 banks of 1Kx32 each. Bit #n controls retention mode for RAM bank #n: 0: Retention disabled 1: Retention enabled NB: If retention is disabled for all banks, the RAM will be powered off when it would otherwise be put in retention mode

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: VIRTOFF
field.description: Controls action when receiving a request to power-off AUX: 0: Power-off AUX 1: Assert reset and stop clock, but keep AUX powered (virtual power-off)

field.name: FIXEDWU
field.description: Controls timing of AUX-wakeup: 0: AUX wake-up is immediately following triggering event 1: AUX wake-up is forced to happen a fixed number of 32 KHz clocks following the triggering event. The number of 32KHz cloc cycles is configured in CONFIG.FIXEDWUPERIOD register. This bit is used to ensure that the AUX is always woken up an exact number of clocks following the triggering event by compensating for any variable delays caused by other activities going on at the time of wakeup (such as a recharge event etc.) NB: Waking up AUX by FORCEON and SWEVENT is not affected by this bit

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SRAMRET
field.description: AUX RAM is a single 512x16 instance. This bit controls retention mode for the RAM: 0: Retention is disabled 1: Retention is enabled NB: If retention is disabled, the RAM will be powered off when it would otherwise be put in retention mode

field.name: RESETREQ
field.description: Reset request for AUX 1: AUX reset pin is asserted 0: AUX reset pin is deasserted

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RUNPROG
field.description: Tells AUX that it has a valid image in the memory 1: AUX will start executing the program in AUXRAM when it wakes up 0: AUX may wake up, but controller will remain in idle since memory image can not be trusted

field.name: SWEVENT
field.description: Forces AUX to be powered on, and a SW event to be sent to the AUX controller: 0: No action 1: Force AUX to be powered on, and generate SW event to AUX

field.name: FORCEON
field.description: Forces AUX to be powered on and held on until forceon is released again. MCU will use this bit to ensure that AUX peripherals remains even if AUX requests to get powered of. 1: AUX can not request power off or disconnect 0: AUX will get powered of when it requests it.

field.name: RES5
field.description: Reserved

field.name: OSCGBIAS
field.description: Indicates OSC GBIAS state: 0: OSC is not requesting GBIAS 1: OSC is requesting GBIAS

field.name: AUXGBIAS
field.description: Indicates AUX GBIAS state: 0: AUX is not requesting GBIAS 1: AUX is requesting GBIAS

field.name: MCUGBIAS
field.description: Indicates MCU GBIAS state: 0: MCU is not requesting GBIAS 1: MCU is requesting GBIAS

field.name: RES4
field.description: Reserved

field.name: OSCBGAP
field.description: Indicates OSC BGAP state: 0: OSC is not requesting BGAP 1: OSC is requesting BGAP

field.name: AUXBGAP
field.description: Indicates AUX BGAP state: 0: AUX is not requesting BGAP 1: AUX is requesting BGAP

field.name: MCUBGAP
field.description: Indicates MCU BGAP state: 0: MCU is not requesting BGAP 1: MCU is requesting BGAP

field.name: RES3
field.description: Reserved

field.name: GBIASON99
field.description: Indicates GBIAS state: 0: GBIAS is powered off 1: GBIAS is powered on and steady within 99%

field.name: GBIASON
field.description: Indicates GBIAS state: 0: GBIAS is powered off 1: GBIAS is powered on and steady within 95%

field.name: BGAPON
field.description: Indicates BGAP state: 0: BGAP is powered off 1: BGAP is powered on

field.name: RES2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: AUXPWRDOWN
field.description: Indicates state of power supply as seen by AUX: 0: Active mode 1: Powerdown mode

field.name: MCUPWRDOWN
field.description: Indicates state of power supply as seen by MCU: 0: Active mode 1: Powerdown mode

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: JTAGPWR
field.description: Indicates JTAG power state: 0: JTAG is powered off 1: JTAG is powered on

field.name: AUXPWR
field.description: Indicates AUX power state: 0: AUX is powered off 1: AUX is powered on and ready for use ( also connected to bus )

field.name: MCUPWR
field.description: Indicates MCU power state: 0: MCU is powered off 1: MCU is powered on

field.name: AUXBUSRESET_DONE
field.description: Indicates Reset Done from AUX Bus: 0: AUX Bus is being reset 1: AUX Bus reset is released

field.name: AUXBUSCONNECT
field.description: Indicates that AUX Bus is connected: 0: AUX bus is not connected 1: AUX bus is connected ( idle_ack = 0 )

field.name: AUXRESET_DONE
field.description: Indicates Reset Done from AUX: 0: AUX is being reset 1: AUX reset is released

field.name: PWRDOWN
field.description: Indicates state of power supply: 0: Active mode 1: Powerdown mode (limited current supply)

field.name: RES
field.description: Reserved

field.name: JTAGOVERRIDE
field.description: This register is ignored. Shutdown requests can be overriden directly from WUCTAP

field.name: EN
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit force all I/O values to be latched – possibly enabling I/O wakeup – then all internal power supplies are turned off, effectively puttng the device into Shutdown mode. Note: The shutdown request / IO latching does not take effect unti next timel system enters powerdown

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: OFFPDDIS
field.description: Controls whether MCU and AUX requesting to be powered off will enable a transition to powerdown: 0: Enabled 1: Disabled

field.name: FIXEDWUPERIOD
field.description: Select the a wakeup period for AUX and MCU wakeup. Wakeup time will take at least the number of lf_clk cycles specified in this register, when enabed by FIXEDWU field in MCUCFG and AUXCFG.

field.name: AUXSRAMERASE
field.description: Asserting this bit will erase the AUX RAM ( by asserting the eroase pin to the RAM macro) Note. This bit can be locked

field.name: MCUSRAMERASE
field.description: Asserting this bit will erase the MCU RAM ( by asserting the eroase pin to the RAM macro) Note: This bit can be locked

field.name: AUXSRAMREPAIR
field.description: SW-controlled bit reflecting the AUX SRAM repair state: 0: AUX SRAM has not been repaired 1: AUX SRAM has been repaired NB: Once the AUX SRAM has been repaired, SW sets this bit. When this bit is set, SW will ensure that AUX SRAM is not being repaired again, as that would corrupt the contents

field.name: MCUSRAMREPAIR
field.description: SW-controlled bit reflecting the MCU SRAM repair state: 0: MCU SRAM has not been repaired 1: MCU SRAM has been repaired NB: Once the MCU SRAM has been repaired, SW sets this bit. When this bit is set, SW will ensure that MCU SRAM is not being repaired again, as that would corrupt the contents

field.name: RES2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TAP_SECURTY_CTRL
field.description: Readback of security ctrl word of WUC_TAP Bit 0: t2c_wuc_sec_chiperase Bit 1:t2c_wuc_sec_totalerase Bit 2:t2c_wuc_sec_bddat Bit 3:t2c_wuc_sec_bdrdy Bit 4 :t2c_wuc_sec_aux_reset_req Bit 5: t2c_wuc_sec_mcu_reset_req Bit 6: t2c_wuc_sec_res6 Bit 7: t2c_wuc_sec_res7

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TOTALERASE
field.description: Request set by WUC TAP to request ROM FW to perform a total Flash erase 0: No action 1: Perform total Flash erase This bit can only be set if the 128-bit unlock key has been entered correctly, but it is NOT dependent on LOCKCFG.BACKDOORENABLE. This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: CHIPERASE
field.description: Request set by WUC TAP to request ROM FW to perform a chip erase 0: No action 1: Perform full Chip erase This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: MCURESETSRC
field.description: Indicates source of last MCU VD warm reset: 0: MCU SW reset 1: JTAG reset This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: MCUWARMRESET
field.description: Indicates type of last MCU VD reset: 0: Last MCU reset was not a warm reset 1: Last MCU reset was a warm reset This bit can only be cleared by writing a 1 to it

field.name: ADEN
field.description: Enable adaptation of recharge period. The details of the adaptation algorithm is described in the spec (TBD)

field.name: RES
field.description: Reserved

field.name: C2
field.description:
Gain factor for adaptive recharge algorithm
period_new=period * ( 1+/-(2^-C1+2^-C2) Valiid values for C2 is 2 to 10

field.name: C1
field.description:
Gain factor for adaptive recharge algorithm
period_new=period * ( 1+/-(2^-C1+2^-C2) Valiid values for C1 is 1 to 10

field.name: MAXRCPERIOD_M
field.description: This register defines the Max period that the recharge algoritm can take, ie it defines the maximum number of cycles between 2 recharges. The maximum number of cycles is specified with a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: MAXCYCLES=({MAXPERIOD_M,4b'1111}<<MAXPERIOD_E) This field sets the mantissa of the MAXPERIOD

field.name: MAXRCPERIOD_E
field.description: This register defines the Max period that the recharge algoritm can take, ie it defines the maximum number of cycles between 2 recharges. The maximum number of cycles is specified with a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: MAXCYCLES=({MAXPERIOD_M,4'b1111}<<MAXPERIOD_E) This field sets the exponent of the MAXPERIOD

field.name: PERIOD_M
field.description:
Number of 32 KHz clocks between activation of recharge controller For recharge algorithm, PERIOD is the initial period when entering powerdown mode. The adaptive recharge algoritm will not change this register PERIOD will effectivly be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent:
This field sets the Mantissat of the Period. PERIOD= ({PERIOD_M,4b'1111} <<PERIOD_E)

field.name: PERIOD_E
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between activation of recharge controller For recharge algorithm, PERIOD is the initial period when entering powerdown mode. The adaptive recharge algoritm will not change this register PERIOD will effectivly be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent: This field sets the Exponent of the Period. PERIOD= ({PERIOD_M,4b'1111} <<PERIOD_E)

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: VDDRSMP
field.description: The last 4 VDDR samples, bit 0 being the newest

field.name: GOODPER
field.description: The maximum value of recharge period seen with VDDR>threshold

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: PERIOD_M
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between oscillator amplitude calibrations. When this counter expires, an oscillator amplitude calibration is triggered immediately in Active mode. When this counter expires in Powerdown mode an internal flag is set that causes GBIAS to turn on together with BGAP when the next recharge occurs, at the same time triggering the oscillator amplitude calibration as well as a recharge of the uLDO reference voltage. The Period will effectivly be a 16 bit value coded in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent PERIOD = ({PERIOD_M,4'b1111} << PERIOD_E) This field sets the mantissa Note: Oscillator amplitude calibration is turned of when both OSCCFG.PERIOD_M and OSCCFG.PERIOD_E are set to 0

field.name: PERIOD_E
field.description: Number of 32 KHz clocks between oscillator amplitude calibrations. When this counter expires, an oscillator amplitude calibration is triggered immediately in Active mode. When this counter expires in Powerdown mode an internal flag is set that causes GBIAS to turn on together with BGAP when the next recharge occurs, at the same time triggering the oscillator amplitude calibration as well as a recharge of the uLDO reference voltage. The Period will effectivly be a 16 bit value codedn in a 5 bit mantissa and 3 bit exponent PERIOD = ({PERIOD_M,4'b1111}} << PERIOD_E) This field sets the exponent Note: Oscillator amplitude calibration is turned of when both OSCCFG.PERIOD_M and OSCCFG.PERIOD_E are set to 0

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: PWRMODE
field.description: Controls JTAG VD power state: 0: Controlled exclusively b y icemelter/icepick 1: JTAG VD is forced on, independent of icemelter/icepick NB: the reset value causes JTAG VD to be powered on by default. SW must clear this bit to turn off the JTAG VD

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: PBIST2TAP
field.description: PBIST2 TAP access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: PBIST1TAP
field.description: PBIST1 TAP access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: RES2
field.description: Reserved

field.name: TESTTAP
field.description: Test TAP access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: WUCTAP
field.description: WUC TAP debug access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled Note that the basic security releated WUC TAP functions described here are always open NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: PRCMTAP
field.description: PRCM access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: CPUDAP
field.description: Main CPU DAP access control: 0: Disabled 1: Enabled NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: USERCODE
field.description: 32-bit JTAG USERCODE register feeding main JTAG TAP NB: This field can be locked

field.name: KEY
field.description: Bit [31:0] of the 128 bit unlock code. NB: This register is write-only and can be locked

field.name: KEY
field.description: Bit [63:32] of the 128 bit unlock code. NB: This register is write-only and can be locked

field.name: KEY
field.description: Bit [95:64] of the 128 bit unlock code. NB: This register is write-only and can be locked

field.name: KEY
field.description: Bit [127:96] of the 128 bit unlock key. NB: This register is write-only and can be locked

field.name: SECURITYSTATE
field.description: Shows Device Security State: 0: Locked 1: Unlocked The Device Security State is unlocked if the efuse unlocked bit is set, or if the correct 128-bit unlock key has been provided (if enabled by LOCKCFG.BACKDOORENABLE). All taps/daps will be open when this bit is set

field.name: STICKYBITOVERRIDE
field.description: Sticky bit Unlock State: 0: Locked 1: Unlocked The Sticky bit Unlock State is unlocked if the correct 128-bit unlock key has been provided (if enabled by LOCKCFG.BACKDOORENABLE). The Stickybitoverrode is propagated to other modules containing Lockable bits to allow them to be unlocked. Also, when the STICKYBITOVERRIDE is set, - LOCKCFG.LOCK can be cleared.

field.name: RES
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SECURITYINITIALIZED
field.description: Indicates to ICEPICK that bootcode has finished security initialization. Bootcode writes to this register as theend of the safezone boot sequence. 1: Security initialization is done 0: Security initialization is not yet done. Note that this bit is not protected.

field.name: BACKDOORENABLE
field.description: Controls 128-bit unlock key feature: 0: Unlock via JTAG is disabled 1: Unlock via JTAG is enabled Note that even if unlock is disabled, total erase of the Flash is still enabled if the entered key is correct NB: This bit can be locked

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Controls access to WUC Lockable bits: 0: Lockable bits in WUC are writeable 1: Lockable bits in WUC can't be written NB: Once set to 1, this bit can only be cleared if the sticky bit unlock is asserted

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: EVTMASK
field.description: Eventmask selecting which delayed event signals are OR'ed together to form the combined event. 16 : Use CH0 delayed event in combined event 17: Use CH1 delayed event in combined event 18: Use CH2 delayed event in combined event

field.name: EVTDELAY
field.description: No of clock cycles the delayed event is delayed 0x0 : no delay 0x1: 1 0x2: 2 0x3: 4 0x4: 8 0x5: 16 0x6: 32 0x7: 48 0x8: 64 0x9: 80 0xA: 96 0xB: 112 0xC: 128 0xD: 144

field.name: RESET
field.description: RESET RTC counter The bit is cleared automatically by HW

field.name: RTCUPDEN
field.description: Enable RTC Update tick (16 Khz signal used in radio) 1: RTC_UPD signal is toggling @16 kHz 0: RTC_UPD signal is 0

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable RTC counter 0: Halted (frozen) 1: Running

register.name: STATUS
register.description: Status register Note: Reading from this register will force an immediate synchronization of the aon status bits. The read operation is stalled for 2 cycles to ensure that data is clocked through the synchronizers

field.name: EVENT2
field.description: Set by HW on CH2 event. Cleared by writing 1, or by writing 1 to CLREVENT2, or asserting EventClr[2] HW pin (done by AUX)

field.name: EVENT1
field.description: Set by HW on CH1 event. Cleared by writing 1, or by writing 1 to CLREVENT1, or asserting EventClr[1] HW pin

field.name: EVENT0
field.description: Set by HW on CH0 event. Cleared by writing 1, or by writing 1 to CLREVENT0, or asserting EventClr[0] HW pin

field.name: SEC
field.description: Unsigned integer counting seconds. Incremented when SUBSEC overflows

field.name: SUBSEC
field.description: the SUBSECINC value

field.name: SUBSECINC
field.description: This value is added to RTC_SUBSEC.SUBSEC on every cycle. To perform the addition, SUBSECINC[23:6] are aligned with SUBSEC[17:0]. The remaining bits SUBSECINC[5:0] are accumulated in a hidden 6-bit register that generates a carry into the above mentioned addition on overflow. The default value corresponds to incrementing by precisely 1/32768 of a second.

field.name: CH2CONTROL
field.description: Set to enable continuous opereation of CH2

field.name: CH2ENABLE
field.description: Set to enable CH2

field.name: CH1MODE
field.description: Set CH1 mode 0: Compare mode (default) 1: Capture mode

field.name: CH1ENABLE
field.description: Set to enable CH1

field.name: CH0ENABLE
field.description: Set to enable CH0

field.name: CMP0
field.description: CH0 compare value When CMP0 == {SEC[15:0],SUBSEC[31:16]}, a CH0 event is generated

field.name: CMP1
field.description: CH1 compare value When CMP1 == {SEC[15:0],SUBSEC[31:16]}, a CH1 event is generated. Only valid if CH1 is in compare mode

field.name: CMP2
field.description: CH2 compare value When CMP2 == {SEC[15:0],SUBSEC[31:16]}, a CH2 event is generated

field.name: CMP2INC
field.description: This value is added to CMP2 following a CH2 event, if CH2 is in continuous mode

field.name: SEC
field.description: CH1 capture value of SEC[15:0], when CH1 capture event occurs. Only valid if CH1 is in capture mode

field.name: SUBSEC
field.description: CH1 capture value fo SUBSEC[31:16], when CH1 capture event occurs. Only valid if CH1 is in capture mode

field.name: WBUSY
field.description: This register will always return 0,- however it will not return the value until there are no outstanding write requests between AONIF and AON Note: Writing to this register prior to reading will force a wait until next LF_CLK edge. This is recommended for syncing read registers from AON when waking up from sleep Failure to do so may result in reading aon values from prior to going to sleep

field.name: RES1
field.description: Reserved

field.name: VDDS3SEGENSET
field.description: When written with a 1, VDDS3 I/O segment is enabled

field.name: VDDS2SEGENSET
field.description: When written with a 1, VDDS2 I/O segment is enabled

field.name: VDDS3SEGENCLR
field.description: When written with a 1, VDDS3 I/O segment is disabled

field.name: VDDS2SEGENCLR
field.description: When written with a 1, VDDS2 I/O segment is disabled

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DCDCACTIVE
field.description: Select if DCDC is used in active mode 1: Use DCDC in active mode. 0: Do not use DCDC in active mode.

field.name: EXTREGMODE
field.description: Status of source for VDDR supply: 0: DCDC/GLDO are to generate VDDR 1: DCDC/GLDO are bypassed, external regulator supplies VDDR

field.name: DCDCEN
field.description: Controls use of DCDC when going from Powerdown to Active due to a wakeup or recharge request 0: Use GLDO 1: Use DCDC

field.name: SYSRESET
field.description: Cold reset register 1: Generate system reset. Appears as pin reset

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: VDDSLOSSENOR
field.description: Override of VDDSLOSSEN 0: Brown out detect of VDDS is ignored, unless VDDSLOSSEN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDS generates system reset This bit can be locked

field.name: VDDRLOSSENOR
field.description: Override of VDDRLOSSEN 0: Brown out detect of VDDR is ignored, unless VDDRLOSSEN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDR generates system reset This bit can be locked

field.name: VDDLOSSENOR
field.description: Override of VDDLOSSEN 0: Brown out detect of VDD is ignored, unless VDDLOSSEN=1 1: Brown out detect of VDD generates system reset This bit can be locked

field.name: CLKLOSSENOR
field.description: Override of CLKLOSSEN Clock loss enable: 0: Clock loss is ignored unless CLKLOSSEN=1 1: Clock loss generates system reset This bit can be locked

field.name: VDDSLOSSEN
field.description: 0: Brown out detect of VDDS is ignored, unless VDDSLOSSENOR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDS generates system reset

field.name: VDDRLOSSEN
field.description: 0: Brown out detect of VDDR is ignored, unless VDDRLOSSENOR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDDR generates system reset

field.name: VDDLOSSEN
field.description: 0: Brown out detect of VDD is ignored, unless VDDLOSSENOR=1 1: Brown out detect of VDD generates system reset

field.name: CLKLOSSEN
field.description: Clock loss enable: 0: Clock loss is ignored, unless CLKLOSSENOR=1 1: Clock loss generates system reset

field.name: RESETSRC
field.description: Shows the source of the last system reset: 000: Power-on 001: RESET pin 010: VDDS BOD 011: VDD BOD 100: VDDR BOD 101: Clock loss 110: Shutdown 111: Reserved NB: latched after reset, hence must be cleared to be prepared to latch the source of a subsequent reset

field.name: RESETSRCCLR
field.description: Clear the reset source: 0: Do not affect reset source 1: Clear reset source This bit is automatically cleared when the operation has been completed

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: SLEEPDIS
field.description: Controls the I/O pad sleep mode: 0: I/O pad sleep mode is enabled 1: I/O pad sleep mode is disabled

field.name: RES0
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: This register is reserved for a additional debuggin features in sysctrl. Bit 0: Disable asynchrouns startup of sysctrl Bit 1: Sysctrl stays in PDACTIVE untill VDDR_OK is seen. Bit 2: 1: Dont check for rcoschf when going to PD Bit 3: 1: Turn off clk_chp Bit 4: 1: Do not indicate to osctop that we are in PD Bit 7:5: Reserved

register.name: INFCLK_RDIV
register.description: INF clock division factor in run mode

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DIVFACTOR
field.description: Division rate for this clock 0: 1 1: 2 2: 8 3: 32 Infrastructure clock This clock is asynchronous and distributed using ULL clock cells. If source clock is 48 MHz, minimum divider is 2.

register.name: INFCLK_SDIV
register.description: INF clock division factor in sleep mode

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DIVFACTOR
field.description: Division rate for this clock 0: 1 1: 2 2: 8 3: 32 Infrastructure clock This clock is asynchronous and distributed using ULL clock cells. If source clock is 48 MHz, minimum divider is 2.

register.name: INFCLK_DSDIV

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DIVFACTOR
field.description: Division rate for this clock 0: 1 1: 2 2: 8 3: 32 Infrastructure clock This clock is asynchronous and distributed using ULL clock cells. If source clock is 48 MHz, minimum divider is 2.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: MFCLK
field.description: Bit is obsolete. The control is placed in MCUCLK.PDSRC in the WUC

field.name: MCU_VD
field.description:
Request WUC to power down the MCU voltage domain 1 - Assert request when CM3 is in deepsleep and RFCORE is idle 0 - No request
The bit will have no effect before 1. RFCORE do no request the bus 2. deepsleep is asserted

field.name: LFCLK
field.description: Bit is obsolete. The control is placed in MCUCLK.PDSRC in the WUC

field.name: ULDO
field.description:
Request WUC to switch to uLDO. 1 - Assert request when possible 0 - No request
The bit will have no effect before the following requirements are met: 1. FLASH has accepted to be powered down 2. deepsleep must be asserted

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: LOAD_STATUS
field.description:
Status of load. Will be cleared to 0 when a write access to any of the registers requiring a load and be set to 1 when a load is done. Note that writing no change to a register will result in the load status being cleared.
0 : One or more registers have been write accessed after last load 1 : No registers are write accessed after last load

field.name: LOAD
field.description:
Write 1 to load settings to CLKCTRL. Bit is HW cleared.
Multiple changes to settings may be done before load is written once so all changes takes place at the same time. LOAD can also be done after single setting updates.
Registers that needs to be followed by LOAD before settings being applied are: - SYSBUSCLK_DIV - CPUCLK_DIV - PERBUSCPUCLK_DIV - PERBUSDMACLK_DIV - PERDMACLK_DIV - CG_PERBUSCPUCLK - CG_PERBUSDMACLK - CG_RFCORECLK - CG_FLASHCLK - RCG_SEC_DMA - SCG_SEC_DMA - DSCG_SEC_DMA - RCG_GPIO - SCG_GPIO - DSCG_GPIO - RCG_GPTM - SCG_GPTM - DSCG_GPTM - GPTM_DIV - RCG_I2C - SCG_I2C - DSCG_I2C - RCG_SSI - SCG_SSI - DSCG_SSI - RCG_UART - SCG_UART - DSCG_UART - RCG_I2S - SCG_I2S - DSCG_I2S - BCLK_CTRL - AGENCN - AGENMDR - AGENBDR - AGENWDR - CONFIG_RAMSIZE

field.name: DIVFACTOR
field.description: Division rate for this clock when sysbusclk is gated and CG_PERBUSCPUCLK = 1. When sysbusclk is running perbuscpuclk use SYSBUSCLK_DIV setting 0: 1 1: 2 2: 4 3: 8 4: 16 5: 32 6: 64 7: 128 8: 256 9: NA (Forced 256) 10: NA (Forced 256) 11: NA (Forced 256) 12: NA (Forced 256) 13: NA (Forced 256) 14: NA (Forced 256) 15: NA (Forced 256)

Software is responsible for selecting a safe frequency. (≤5/3 perbusdmaclk for uart operation, ≤ perbusdmaclk for ssi operation)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.description: Not in use

field.name: SEL
field.description: BCLK source selector 0: Use external bclk 1: Use internally generated clock

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: DIVFACTOR
field.description: Scalar used for GPTMs. The division rate will be constant and ungated for Run / Sleep/ DeepSleep mode when it is slower than the PERBUSCPU_DIV setting. When set faster than PERBUSCPU_DIV setting the PERBUSCPU_DIV will be used. Note that the register will contain the written content even though the setting is faster that PERBUSCUP_DIV setting. 0: 1 1: 2 2: 4 3: 8 4: 16 5: 32 6: 64 7: 128 8: 256 9: NA (Forced 256) 10: NA (Forced 256) 11: NA (Forced 256) 12: NA (Forced 256) 13: NA (Forced 256) 14: NA (Forced 256) 15: NA (Forced 256)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: ADRP
field.description: Active edge of clk_bclk in the audio interface module. If set, wclkgen is toggled on negative edge of bclkgen. Opposite if not set.

field.name: WCLKPHS
field.description: Decides how the wclkgen division ratio is calculated and used to generate different duty cycles (WDIV in the AGENWDR register). 00 – Single phase 01 – Dual phase 10 – User Defined 11 – Reserved/Undefined

field.name: MBWEN
field.description: Enables the generation of mclkgen, bclkgen, wclkgen and wclkgen_n when set. If disabled, mclkgen, bclkgen and wclkgen will be static low, while wclkgen_n will be static high.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: MDIV
field.description:
An unsigned factor of the division ratio used to generate mclkgen [2-1024]:
mclkgen = clk_aclk/MDIV[Hz]
A value of 0 is interpreted as 1024. A value of 1 is invalid. If MDIV is odd the low phase of the clock is one clk_aclk period longer than the high phase.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: BDIV
field.description:
An unsigned factor of the division ratio used to generate bclkgen [2-1024]:
bclkgen = clk_aclk/MDIV[Hz]
A value of 0 is interpreted as 1024. A value of 1 is invalid. If BDIV is odd and ADRP=0, the low phase of the clock is one clk_aclk period longer than the high phase, if ADRP=1 the high phase is longer.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: WDIV
field.description:
If WCLKPHS = 00, Single phase. wclkgen is high one bclkgen period and low WDIV[9:0] (unsigned, [1-1023]) bclkgen periods.
wclkgen = clk_aclk / BDIV*(WDIV[9:0] + 1) [Hz]
If WCLKPHS = 01, Dual phase. Each phase on wclkgen (50% duty cycle) is WDIV[9:0] (unsigned, [1-1023]) bclkgen periods.
wclkgen = clk_aclk / BDIV*(2*WDIV[9:0]) [Hz]
If WCLKPHS = 10, User defined. wclkgen is high WDIV[7:0] (unsigned, [1-255]) bclkgen periods and low WDIV[15:8] (unsigned, [1-255]) bclkgen periods.
wclkgen = clk_aclk / (BDIV*(WDIV[7:0] + WDIV[15:8]) [Hz]

field.name: MCU

Write 1 generates reset request to WUC to reset the entire MCU voltage domain. Request is cleared by HW.
Everything in MCU voltage domain reset including PRCM itself

field.name: RFCORE
field.description: Write 1 generates reset pulse on reset_rfcore_n. HW cleared Acess will only have effect when RFCORE power domain is on (SWPWR_STATUS.RFCORE = 1)

field.name: CPU

field.name: WDT_STATUS
field.description: 0 - No registred event 1 - A WDT event has occured since last SW clear of the register. A read of this register clears both status bits.

field.name: FL_BUS
field.description: 1 - VIMS power domain is powered whenever the BUS power domain is powered. 0 - VIMS power domain is only powered when CPU is powered.

field.name: RFC
field.description:
1 - RFCORE power domain powered on 0 - RFCORE power domain powered off if also SWPWR_CTRL.RFC = '0'
Bit shall be used by RFCORE in autonomus mode but there is no HW restrictions fom CM3 to access the bit.

field.name: CPU
field.description: Setting this bit to ‘1’ initiates power-on of the CPU power domain. Setting this bit to ‘0’ causes a power down of the CPU power domain when CPU indicates it is idle, and initiates power-down of the BUS and SRAM power domains when BUS_RFC=0. This bit shall be automatically set by a WIC power-on event.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Lock all config, write-once and sticky bits in PRCM. Wiriting '1' to this bit also locks writing to this bit itself. 0: Sticky, write-once and config bits may be altered 1: Sticky, write-once and config bits locked for editing. Bit may be altered if stickybit_overide is asserted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: RAMSIZE
field.description: Only writeable when PRCM_LOCKED = '0' Must be loaded with CLKCTRL.LOAD before taking effect 00 - 2k 01 - 4k 10 - 8k 11 - 16k

field.name: DELAY
field.description: This bit shall be written with care! Can only be written when LOCK_PSW.LOCK = 0 Control the time between the last weak switch closed to the first strong switch can be closed. From power-on the reset value will be used but SW may update this register to shorten the delay. The dealy is defined by two system clock periods per integer in this register. I.e if set to 03 and the system runs at 48MHz the delay will be six 48MHz periods long. Writing a too low value to this register may result in LDO voltage drop and possible flash corruption! Don't!

field.name: S_JSTART
field.description: This bits shall be written with care! Can only be written when LOCK_PSW.LOCK = 0 Strong Jump Start switch control that minimize the power up time for power domains. During test information about production corner shall be stored in Flash. From power-on the worst case will be used but SW may update this register to jump-start the number of weak switches that can be connected simultaneously when power domains are powered up. The coding is temperature so only 0 - 1 - 3 - 7 are valid values. Writing a too high or invalid value to this register may result in LDO voltage drop and possible flash corruption! Don't!

field.name: S_PCNT
field.description: This bit shall be written with care! Can only be written when LOCK_PSW.LOCK = 0 Defines number of undivided INFCLK perioods between each group of weak switches closing. 00 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 1 period after PONIN[n] 01 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 2 periods after PONIN[n] 10 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 3 periods after PONIN[n] 11 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 4 periods after PONIN[n] Writing a too low value to this register may result in LDO voltage drop and possible flash corruption! Don't!

field.name: W_JSTART
field.description: This bits shall be written with care! Can only be written when LOCK_PSW.LOCK = 0 Weak Jump Start switch control that minimize the power up time for power domains. During test information about production corner shall be stored in Flash. From power-on the worst case will be used but SW may update this register to jump-start the number of weak switches that can be connected simultaneously when power domains are powered up. The coding is temperature so only 0000 - 0001 - 0003 -0007 - 000F - 001F - 003F ... - 1FFF are valid values. Writing a too high or invalid value to this register may result in LDO voltage drop and possible flash corruption! Don't!

field.name: W_PCNT
field.description: This bit shall be written with care! Can only be written when LOCK_PSW.LOCK = 0 Defines number of undivided INFCLK perioods between each group of weak switches closing. 00 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 1 period after PONIN[n] 01 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 2 periods after PONIN[n] 10 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 3 periods after PONIN[n] 11 - PONIN[n+1] = closed 4 periods after PONIN[n] Writing a too low value to this register may result in LDO voltage drop and possible flash corruption! Don't!

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: BUS
field.description: BUS Power domain Writing 0 to this bit shall only be done for debug. When written 0 the BUS powerdomain is powered down regardless of other settings.

field.name: VIMS

field.name: CPU
field.description: CPU Power domain Writing 0 to this bit shall only be done for debug. When written 0 the CPU powerdomain is powered down regardless of other settings.

field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: TRIG
field.description: 0: No action 1: Generates a resetpulse that resets all MCU LL logic but configuration registers. Same result as a WDT timeout. Bit is HW cleared.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SERIAL
field.description: 0: No action 1: Force SERIAL PD on

field.name: PERIPH
field.description: 0: No action 1: Force PERIPH PD on

field.name: RFCORE
field.description: 0: No action 1: Force RFCORE PD on

field.name: VIMS
field.description: 0: No action 1: Force VIMS PD on

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: ON
field.description: 0: Turn off TEST PD 1: Turn on TEST PD

field.name: TEST
field.description: 0x0 --> Controller does not include the integration test logic 0x1 --> Controller includes the integration test logic 0x2 - 0xF --> Undefined

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Undefined

field.name: TOTALCHANNELS
field.description:
Number of available DMA channels minus one. For example
b00000 --> Controller configured to use 1 DMA channel b00001 --> Controller configured to use 2 DMA channel . . b11111 --> Controller configured to use 32 DMA channel

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined

field.name: STATE
field.description:
Current state of the control state machine. State can be one of the following:
b0000 --> idle b0001 --> reading channel controller data b0010 --> reading source data end pointer b0011 --> reading destination data end pointer b0100 --> reading source data b0101 --> writing destination data b0110 --> waiting for DMA request to clear b0111 --> writing channel controller data b1000 --> stalled b1001 --> done b1010 --> peripheral scatter-gather transition b1011-b1111 --> undefined.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Undefined

field.name: MASTERENABLE
field.description:
Enable status of the controller:
0 --> Controller is disabled 1 --> Controller is enabled

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined. Write as zero

field.name: PRTOCTRL
field.description:
Sets the AHB-Lite protection by controlling the HPROT[3:1] signal levels as follows:
Bit [7] Controls HPROT[3] to indicate if a cacheable access is occurring. Bit [6] Controls HPROT[2] to indicate if a bufferable access is occurring. Bit [5] Controls HPROT[1] to indicate if a privileged access is occurring.
When bit [n] = 1 then the corresponding HPROT is HIGH. When bit [n] = 0 then the corresponding HPROT is LOW.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Undefined. Write as zero

field.name: MASTERENABLE
field.description:
Enables the controller:
0 --> Disables the controller 1 --> Enables the controller

field.name: BASEPTR
field.description: Pointer to the base address of the primary data structure

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined. Write as zero

register.name: ALTCTRL
register.description: Channel alternate control data base pointer

field.name: BASEPTR
field.description: Base address of the alternate data structure

field.name: CHNLSTATUS
field.description:
Channel wait on request status:
Bit [C] = 0 --> dma_waitonreq[C] is low Bit [C] = 1 --> dma_waitonreq[C] is high

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to generate a software DMA request on the corresponding DMA channel
Bit [C] = 0 --> Does not creare a DMA request for channel C Bit [C] = 1 --> Creates a DMA request for channel C
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented does not create a DMA request for that channel

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Returns the useburst status, or disables dma_sreq[C] from generating DMA requests. Read as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> DMA channel C responds to requests that it receives on dma_req[C] or dma_sreq[C]. The controller performs 2R, or single, bus transfers.
Bit [C] = --> 1 DMA channel C does not respond to requests that it receives on dma_sreq[C]. The controller only responds to dma_req[C] requests and performs 2R transfers.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the CLEARBURST Register to set bit [C] to 0. Bit [C] = 1 --> Disables dma_sreq[C] from generating DMA requests. The controller performs 2R transfers.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to enable dma_sreq[] to generate requests. Write as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the SETBURST Register to disable dma_sreq[] from generating requests.
Bit [C] = 1 --> Enables dma_sreq[C] to generate DMA requests.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Returns the request mask status of dma_req[] and dma_sreq[], or disables the corresponding channel from generating DMA requests. Read as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> External requests are enabled for channel C. Bit [C] = 1 --> External requests are disabled for channel C.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the chnl_req_mask_clr Register to enable DMA requests. Bit [C] = 1 --> Disables dma_req[C] and dma_sreq[C] from generating DMA requests.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to enable DMA request for the channel corresponding to dma_req[] and dma_sreq[]. Write as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> Use the SETREQMASK Register to disable dma_req[] and dma_sreq[] from generating requests Bit [C] = 1 --> Enables dma_req[C] or dma_sreq[C] to generate DMA requests.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect.

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Returns the enable status of the channels, or enables the corresponding channels. Read as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> Channel C is disabled. Bit [C] = 1 --> Channel C is enabled.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the CLEARCHANNELEN Register to disable a channel Bit [C] = 1 --> Enables channel C
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to disable the corresponding DMA channel. Write as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the SETCHANNELEN Register to enable DMA channels. Bit [C] = 1 --> Disables channel C.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Returns the channel control data structure status, or selects the alternate data structure for the corresponding DMA channel. Read as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> DMA channel C is using the primary data structure. Bit [C] = 1 --> DMA channel C is using the alternate data structure.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the CLEARCHNLPRIALT Register to disable a channel Bit [C] = 1 --> Selects the alternate data structure for channel C.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to select the primary data structure for the corresponding DMA channel.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the SETCHNLPRIALT Register to select the alternate data structure. Bit [C] = 1 --> Selects the primary data structure for channel C.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Returns the channel priority mask status, or sets the channel priority to high. Read as:
Bit [C] = 0 --> DMA channel C is using the default priority level. Bit [C] = 1 --> DMA channel C is using a high priority level.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the CLEARCHNLPRIORITY Register to set channel C to the default priority level. Bit [C] = 1 --> Channel C uses the high priority level.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Set the appropriate bit to select the default priority level for the specified DMA channel.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Use the SETCHNLPRIORITY Register to set channel C to the high priority level. Bit [C] = 1 --> Channel C uses the default priority level.
Writing to a bit where a DMA channel is not implemented has no effect

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined. Write as zero

field.name: STATUS
field.description:
Returns the status of dma_err, or sets the signal LOW.
Read as: 0 --> dma_err is LOW 1 --> dma_err is HIGH
Write as: 0 --> No effect, status of dma_err is unchanged. 1 --> Sets dma_err LOW.

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Reflects the dma_done status for the given channel. It's a sticky done bit. Unless cleared by writing '1', it holds the value of '1'.
Read as: Bit [C] = 0 --> Request is not completed for the channel C Bit [C] = 1 --> Request is completed for the channel C
Writing a 1 to individual bits would clear the corresponding “dmareqdone” bit.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> No effect. Bit [C] = 1 --> dmareqdone[C] bit is cleared and is set to '0'.

field.name: CHNLS
field.description:
Controls the propagation of "dma_done" and "dma_active" signals to the peripherals. Specifically used for software channels.
Read as: Bit [C] = 0 --> "dma_done" and "dma_active" signals are not blocked from reaching to the peripherals. Also, dma_done of channel [C] is blocked from contributing to generation of combined dma_done (“dma_done_sft”) coming out of DMA wrapper.
Bit [C] = 1 --> "dma_done" and "dma_active" signals are blocked from reaching to the peripherals. Also, dma_done of channel [C] is not blocked from contributing to generation of combined dma_done (“dma_done_sft”) coming out of DMA wrapper.
Write as: Bit [C] = 0 --> Allows "dma_done" and "dma_active" signals to propagate to the peripherals. Also, this disables dma_done of channel [C] from contributing to generation of combined dma_done (“dma_done_sft”) coming out of DMA wrapper.
Bit [C] = 1 --> Blocks "dma_done" and "dma_active" signals to propagate to the peripherals. Also, this enables dma_done of channel [C] to contribute to generation of combined dma_done (“dma_done_sft”) coming out of DMA wrapper.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined

field.name: BLOCKCOUNT
field.description: The number of 4KB address blocks you require, to access the registers, expressed in powers of 2. These bits read back as 0x0.

field.name: JEP106C
field.description: The JEP106 continuation code value represents how many 0x7F continuation characters occur in the manufacturer’s identity code. These bits read back as 0x4.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined

field.name: PARTNUMBER0
field.description: These bits read back as 0x30

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined

field.name: JEP106CODE3TO0
field.description: JEP106 identity code [3:0]. These bits read back as 0xB because ARM is the designer of the peripheral.

field.name: PARTNUMBER1
field.description: These bits read back as 0x2.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Undefined

field.name: REVISION
field.description: The revision status of the controller. For revision r0p0, these bits read back as 0x0.

field.name: JEDEC
field.description: This indicates that the controller uses a manufacturer’s identity code that was allocated by JEDEC according to JEP106. These bits always read back as 0x1.

field.name: JEP106CODE6TO4
field.description: JEP106 identity code [6:4]. These bits read back as 0x3 because ARM is the designer of this peripheral.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Undefined

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved for future use. Reads are undefined.

field.name: MODNUMBER
field.description: The customer must update this field if they modify the RTL of the controller. ARM set this to 0x0.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined

field.name: ID0
field.description: These bits read back as 0x0D.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined

field.name: ID1
field.description: These bits read back as 0xF0.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined

field.name: ID2
field.description: These bits read back as 0x05

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Undefined

field.name: ID3
field.description: These bits read back as 0xB1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: WCLK_INV
field.description: Inverts WCLK source (pad or internal) when set.

field.name: WCLK_SRC
field.description: Selects the one and only WCLK source for AIF, which should be the same as the BCLK source (the BCLK source is selected externally).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: END_FRAME_IDX
field.description: Writing a non-zero value to this register enables and initializes AIF. Note that before doing so, all other configuration must have been done, and AIFINPTR/AIFOUTPTR must have been loaded. Writing a non-zero value to this register enables and initializes AIF. Note that before doing so, all other configuration must have been done, and AIFINPTR/AIFOUTPTR must have been loaded.

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AD2_DIR
field.description: Configures the AD2 audio data pin usage 11 - Reserved

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AD1_DIR
field.description: Configures the AD1 audio data pin usage: 11 - Reserved

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AD0_DIR
field.description: Configures the AD0 audio data pin usage 11 - Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: DATA_DELAY
field.description: The number of BCLK periods between the positive WCLK edge and MSB of the first word in a phase: 0 - LJF format 1 - I2S and DSP format 2-255 - RJF format Note: When 0, MSB of the next word will be output in the idle period between LSB of the previous word and the start of the next word. Otherwise logical 0 will be output until the data delay has expired.

field.name: MEM_LEN_24
field.description: The size of each word stored to or loaded from memory: 0 - 16-bit (one 16 bit access per sample)1 - 24-bit (one 8 bit and one 16 bit locked access per sample)

field.name: SMPL_EDGE
field.description: On the serial audio interface, data (and wclk) is sampled and clocked out on opposite edges of BCLK.

field.name: DUAL_PHASE
field.description: Selects dual- or single-phase format. When set, dual-phase format is selected.

field.name: WORD_LEN
field.description: Number of bits per word (8-24):In single-phase format, this is the exact number of bits per word. In dual-phase format, this is the maximum number of bits per word.

register.name: AIFWMSK0
register.description: Word Selection Bit Mask for Pin x (x is 0, 1 or 2)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: MSK
field.description: Bit-mask indicating valid channels in a frame on ADx. In single-phase mode, each bit represents one channel, starting with LSB for the first word in the frame. A frame can contain up to 8 channels. Channels that are not included in the mask will not be sampled and stored in memory, and clocked out as '0'. In dual-phase mode, only the two LSBs are considered. For a stereo configuration, set both bits. For a mono configuration, set bit 0 only. In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated when clocked out. If all bits are zero, no input words will be stored to memory, and the output data lines will be constant '0'. This can be utilized when PWM debug output is desired without any actively used output pins.

register.name: AIFWMSK1
register.description: Word Selection Bit Mask for Pin x (x is 0, 1 or 2)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: MSK
field.description: Bit-mask indicating valid channels in a frame on ADx. In single-phase mode, each bit represents one channel, starting with LSB for the first word in the frame. A frame can contain up to 8 channels. Channels that are not included in the mask will not be sampled and stored in memory, and clocked out as '0'. In dual-phase mode, only the two LSBs are considered. For a stereo configuration, set both bits. For a mono configuration, set bit 0 only. In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated when clocked out. If all bits are zero, no input words will be stored to memory, and the output data lines will be constant '0'. This can be utilized when PWM debug output is desired without any actively used output pins.

register.name: AIFWMSK2
register.description: Word Selection Bit Mask for Pin x (x is 0, 1 or 2)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: MSK
field.description: Bit-mask indicating valid channels in a frame on ADx. In single-phase mode, each bit represents one channel, starting with LSB for the first word in the frame. A frame can contain up to 8 channels. Channels that are not included in the mask will not be sampled and stored in memory, and clocked out as '0'. In dual-phase mode, only the two LSBs are considered. For a stereo configuration, set both bits. For a mono configuration, set bit 0 only. In mono mode, only channel 0 will be sampled and stored to memory, and channel 0 will be repeated when clocked out. If all bits are zero, no input words will be stored to memory, and the output data lines will be constant '0'. This can be utilized when PWM debug output is desired without any actively used output pins.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: VAL
field.description: The value written to this register determines the width of the active high PWM pulse (pwm_debug), which starts together with MSB of the first output word in a DMA buffer: 0 - Constant low 1-65534 - Width of the pulse (number of BCLK cycles). 65535 - Constant high Note: The PWM pulse is also constant high when the configured width equals or exceeds the PWM period (i.e. the duration of a DMA buffer). Note: At least one output pin must be configured for the PWM function to be operational. Note: This value should preferably be written when starting on a new block, after the aif_dma_in_irq interrupt has occurred, or after aif_dma_out_irq + a delay corresponding to 3 samples. If written when a new PWM pulse begins, the length of the pulse is undetermined (and possible equal to neither the current nor the previous PWM value).

field.name: PTR
field.description: Pointer to the first byte in the next DMA input buffer. The read value equals the last written value until the currently used DMA input buffer is completed, and then becomes NULL when the last written value is transferred to the DMA controller to start on the next buffer. This event is signalized by aif_dma_in_irq. At startup, the value should be written once before and once after configuring the DMA buffer size in AIFDMACFG. The next pointer must be written to AIFINPTR while the DMA function uses the previously written pointer. If not written in time, AIFERR.PTR_ERR will be raised and all input pins will be disabled. Note the following limitations: • Address space wrapping is not supported (i.e. address(last sample) must be higher than address(first sample). • A DMA block cannot be aligned with the end of the address space (i.e. a block cannot contain the address 0xFFFF)

field.name: PTR
field.description: Value of the DMA input buffer pointer currently used by the DMA controller (incremented by 1 (byte) or 2 (word) for each AHB access).

field.name: PTR
field.description: Pointer to the first byte in the next DMA output buffer. The read value equals the last written value until the currently used DMA output buffer is completed, and then becomes NULL when the last written value is transferred to the DMA controller to start on the next buffer. This event is signalized by aif_dma_out_irq. At startup, the value should be written once before and once after configuring the DMA buffer size in AIFDMACFG. At this time, the first two samples will be fetched from memory. The next pointer must be written to AIFOUTPTR while the DMA function uses the previously written pointer. If not written in time, AIFERR.PTR_ERR will be raised and all output pins will be disabled. Note the following limitations: • Address space wrapping is not supported (i.e. address(last sample) must be higher than address(first sample). • A DMA block cannot be aligned with the end of the address space (i.e. a block cannot contain the address 0xFFFF)

field.name: PTR
field.description: Value of the DMA output buffer pointer currently used by the DMA controller (incremented by 1 (byte) or 2 (word) for each AHB access).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: OUT_READY
field.description: Low until the output pins are ready to be started by the samplestamp generator. When started (i.e. STMPOUTTRIG equals the WCLK counter) the bit goes back low.

field.name: IN_READY
field.description: Low until the input pins are ready to be started by the samplestamp generator. When started (i.e. STMPINTRIG equals the WCLK counter) the bit goes back low.

field.name: STMP_EN
field.description: Enables the samplestamp generator. The samplestamp generator should only be enabled after it has been properly configured. When cleared, all samplestamp generator counters and capture values are cleared.

register.name: STMPXCNTC0
register.description: Captured XOSC Counter Value, Capture Channel 0

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_XCNT_CAPT0
field.description: The value of the samplestamp XOSC counter last time samplestamp_req(0) was pulsed. This number corresponds to the number of 24 MHz clock cycles since the last positive edge of the selected WCLK. The value is cleared when STMPCTRL.STMP_EN is 0. Note: Due to buffering and synchronization, WCLK is delayed by a small number of clk_bclk periods and clk periods. Note: When calculating the fractional part of the sample stamp, STMPXPER may be less than STMPXCNTC0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_XPER
field.description: The number of 24 MHz clock cycles in the previous WCLK period (i.e. the next value of the XOSC counter at the positive WCLK edge, had it not been reset to 0). The value is cleared when STMPCTRL.STMP_EN is 0.

register.name: STMPWCNTC0
register.description: Captured WCLK Counter Value, Capture Channel 0

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WCNT_CAPT0
field.description: The value of the samplestamp WCLK counter last time samplestamp_req(0) was pulsed. This number corresponds to the number of positive WCLK edges since the samplestamp generator was enabled (not taking modification through STMPWADD/STMPWSET into account). The value is cleared when STMPCTRL.STMP_EN is 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WPER
field.description: Modulo value for the WCLK counter. This number should correspond to the size of the sample buffer used by the system (i.e. the index of the last sample plus 1).

register.name: STMPINTRIG
register.description: WCLK Counter Trigger Value for Input Pins

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: IN_START_WCNT
field.description: Compare value used to start the incoming audio streams. IN_START_WCNT shall equal the WCLK counter value during the WCLK period in which the first input word(s) are sampled and stored to memory (i.e. the sample at the start of the very first DMA input buffer). The value of this register takes effect when the following conditions are met: - One or more pins are configured as inputs in AIFDIRCFG. - AIFDMACFG has been configured for the correct buffer size, and 32 clk_bclk cycles or more have passed afterwards. Note: To avoid false triggers, IN_START_WCNT should be set higher than STMP_WPER.

register.name: STMPOUTTRIG
register.description: WCLK Counter Trigger Value for Output Pins

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: OUT_START_WCNT
field.description: Compare value used to start the outgoing audio streams. OUT_START_WCNT shall equal the WCLK counter value during the WCLK period in which the first output word(s) read from memory are clocked out (i.e. the sample at the start of the very first DMA output buffer). The value of this register takes effect when the following conditions are met: - One or more pins are configured as outputs in AIFDIRCFG. - AIFDMACFG has been configured for the correct buffer size, and 32 clk_bclk cycles or more have passed afterwards. - 2 samples have been preloaded from memory (examine the AIFDOUTPTR register if necessary). Note: The memory read access is only performed when required, i.e. channels 0/1 must be selected in AIFWMSKx. Note: To avoid false triggers, OUT_START_WCNT should be set higher than STMP_WPER.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WCNT_SET
field.description: WCLK counter modification: Set the running WCLK counter equal to the written value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WCNT_ADD
field.description: WCLK counter modification: Add the written value to the running WCLK counter. If a positive edge of WCLK occurs at the same time as the operation, this will be taken into account. This operation is typically used to adjust the WCLK counter after receiving the first WASP beacon. To add a negative value, write "STMP_WPER - value".

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_XPER_MIN
field.description: Each time STMPXPER is updated, the value is also loaded into this register, provided that the value is smaller than the current value of STMPXPERMIN. When written, the register is reset to 65535, regardless of the value written. The minimum value can be used to detect extra WCLK pulses (the STMPXPERMIN value will be significantly smaller than STMPXPER).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WCNT_CURR
field.description: Current value of the WCLK counter

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_XCNT_CURR
field.description: Current value of the XOSC counter, latched when reading STMPWCNT.

register.name: STMPXCNTC1
register.description: Captured XOSC Counter Value, Capture Channel 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_XCNT_CAPT1
field.description: The value of the samplestamp XOSC counter last time samplestamp_req(1) was pulsed. This number corresponds to the number of 24 MHz clock cycles since the last positive edge of the selected WCLK. The value is cleared when STMPCTRL.STMP_EN is 0. Note: Due to buffering and synchronization, WCLK is delayed by a small number of clk_bclk periods and clk periods. Note: When calculating the fractional part of the sample stamp, STMPXPER may be less than STMPXCNTC1.

register.name: STMPWCNTC1
register.description: Captured WCLK Counter Value, Capture Channel 1

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: STMP_WCNT_CAPT1
field.description: The value of the samplestamp WCLK counter last time samplestamp_req(1) was pulsed. This number corresponds to the number of positive WCLK edges since the samplestamp generator was enabled (not taking modification through STMPWADD/STMPWSET into account). The value is cleared when STMPCTRL.STMP_EN is 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_IN

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_OUT

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of WCLK_TIMEOUT

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of BUS_ERR

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of WCLK_ERR

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: This bit masks the level interrupt of PTR_ERR

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: This bit reads the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_IN (auto cleared when input pointer is updated - AIFINPTR)

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: This bit reads the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_OUT (auto cleared when out pointer is updated – AIFOUTPTR)

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: Set when the sample stamp generator does not detect a positive WCLK edge for 65535 clk periods. This signalizes that the internal/external BCLK/WCLK generator source has been disabled. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '0' to it).

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: Set when a DMA operation is not completed in time (i.e. audio output buffer underflow, or audio input buffer overflow). This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '0' to it).

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: Set when: • An unexpected WCLK edge occurs during the data delay period of a phase. Note unexpected WCLK edges during the word and idle periods of the phase are not detected. • In dual-phase mode, when two WCLK edges are less than 4 BCLK cycles apart. • In single-phase mode, when a WCLK pulse occurs before the last channel. This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '0' to it).

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: Set when AIFINPTR or AIFOUTPTR has not been loaded with the next block address in time. This error requires a complete restart since word synchronization has been lost. The bit is sticky and may only be cleared by software (by writing '0' to it).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_IN_IRQ (unless a auto clear criteria was given at the same time, in which the set will be ignored)

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_OUT_IRQ (unless a auto clear criteria was given at the same time, in which the set will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of WCLK_TIMEOUT

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of BUS_ERR

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of WCLK_ERR

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit sets the level interrupt of PTR_ERR

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved - unused

field.name: AIF_DMA_IN
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_IN_IRQ (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: AIF_DMA_OUT
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of AIF_DMA_OUT_IRQ (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_TIMEOUT
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of WCLK_TIMEOUT (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: BUS_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of BUS_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: WCLK_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of WCLK_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: PTR_ERR
field.description: A write '1' to this bit clears the level interrupt of PTR_ERR (unless a set criteria was given at the same time in which the clear will be ignored)

field.name: OEIM
field.description: Overrun error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTOEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTOEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: BEIM
field.description: Break error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTBEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTBEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: PEIM
field.description: Parity error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTPEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTPEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: FEIM
field.description: Framing error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTFEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTFEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: RTIM
field.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRTINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRTINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: TXIM
field.description: Transmit interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTTXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTTXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: RXIM
field.description: Receive interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Reserved, read as zero, do not modify

field.name: CTSMIM

field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: OERIS
field.description: Overrun error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.

field.name: BERIS
field.description: Break error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.

field.name: PERIS
field.description: Parity error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.

field.name: FERIS
field.description: Framing error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.

field.name: RTRIS
field.description: Receive timeout interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt (In this case the raw interrupt cannot be set unless the mask is set, this is because the mask acts as an enable for power saving. That is, the same status can be read from UARTMIS and UARTRIS for the receive timeout interrupt.)

field.name: TXRIS
field.description: Transmit interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.

field.name: RXRIS
field.description: Receive interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED1
