field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: IO Mode (N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX) 000: Normal input/output: (Y_int=Y_pad, A_pad=A_int) 001: Inverted input/ouput: (Y_int=not(Y_pad), A_pad=not(A_int)) 010: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: TDI
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDI It must always be one IO that is set as TDI. If another IO is set as TDI, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: TDO
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDO It must always be one IO that is set as TDO. If another IO is set as TDO, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: EDINT
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if edge detection is enabled) 0: No interrupt generation

field.name: EDET
field.description:
Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO.
00: No edge detection 01: Negative edge detection 10: Positive edge detection 11: Positive and negative edge detection

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PULLEN
field.description: 11: No pull 10: Pull up 01: Pull down 00: Reserved

field.name: IOSC
field.description: 1: Enables slew control on output

field.name: IOCC
field.description: Selects IO current in combination with IOSTR 00: 2mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 00) 01: 4mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 01) 10: 4 or 8mA (8 mA if master is double drive strength) Setting sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 11) 11: up to 16 mA (for double bonded pads (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC=11 on all connected pads)

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select drive strength IO 00: Automatic drive strength (2/4/8mA@VDDS) 01: Minimum drive strength (2/4/8mA@3.3V) 10: Medium drive strength (2/4/8mA@2.5V) 11: Maximum drive strength (2/4/8mA@1.8V)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PORTID
field.description:
PORTID=0: Selects GPIO (#N) >0 Selects peripheral port # PORTID. Except PORTID=8 which is reserved for AUX.
Ports with PORTID from 1 to PORTCNT_EXT are reserved for external peripherals in the AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

field.description: Selects IO current in combination with IOSTR 00: 2mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 00) 01: 4mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 01) 10: 4 or 8mA (8 mA if master is double drive strength) Setting sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 11) 11: up to 16 mA (for double bonded pads (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC=11 on all connected pads)

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select drive strength IO 00: Automatic drive strength (2/4/8mA@VDDS) 01: Minimum drive strength (2/4/8mA@3.3V) 10: Medium drive strength (2/4/8mA@2.5V) 11: Maximum drive strength (2/4/8mA@1.8V)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PORTID
field.description:
PORTID=0: Selects GPIO (#N) >0 Selects peripheral port # PORTID. Except PORTID=8 which is reserved for AUX.
Ports with PORTID from 1 to PORTCNT_EXT are reserved for external peripherals in the AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: IO Mode (N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX) 000: Normal input/output: (Y_int=Y_pad, A_pad=A_int) 001: Inverted input/ouput: (Y_int=not(Y_pad), A_pad=not(A_int)) 010: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: TDI
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDI It must always be one IO that is set as TDI. If another IO is set as TDI, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: TDO
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDO It must always be one IO that is set as TDO. If another IO is set as TDO, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: EDINT
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if edge detection is enabled) 0: No interrupt generation

field.name: EDET
field.description:
Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO.
00: No edge detection 01: Negative edge detection 10: Positive edge detection 11: Positive and negative edge detection

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PULLEN
field.description: 11: No pull 10: Pull up 01: Pull down 00: Reserved

field.name: IOSC
field.description: 1: Enables slew control on output

field.name: IOCC
field.description: Selects IO current in combination with IOSTR 00: 2mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 00) 01: 4mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 01) 10: 4 or 8mA (8 mA if master is double drive strength) Setting sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 11) 11: up to 16 mA (for double bonded pads (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC=11 on all connected pads)

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select drive strength IO 00: Automatic drive strength (2/4/8mA@VDDS) 01: Minimum drive strength (2/4/8mA@3.3V) 10: Medium drive strength (2/4/8mA@2.5V) 11: Maximum drive strength (2/4/8mA@1.8V)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PORTID
field.description:
PORTID=0: Selects GPIO (#N) >0 Selects peripheral port # PORTID. Except PORTID=8 which is reserved for AUX.
Ports with PORTID from 1 to PORTCNT_EXT are reserved for external peripherals in the AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: IO Mode (N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX) 000: Normal input/output: (Y_int=Y_pad, A_pad=A_int) 001: Inverted input/ouput: (Y_int=not(Y_pad), A_pad=not(A_int)) 010: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. field.description: Selects IO current in combination with IOSTR 00: 2mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 00) 01: 4mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 01) 10: 4 or 8mA (8 mA if master is double drive strength) Setting sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 11) 11: up to 16 mA (for double bonded pads (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC=11 on all connected pads)

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select drive strength IO 00: Automatic drive strength (2/4/8mA@VDDS) 01: Minimum drive strength (2/4/8mA@3.3V) 10: Medium drive strength (2/4/8mA@2.5V) 11: Maximum drive strength (2/4/8mA@1.8V)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PORTID
field.description:
PORTID=0: Selects GPIO (#N) >0 Selects peripheral port # PORTID. Except PORTID=8 which is reserved for AUX.
Ports with PORTID from 1 to PORTCNT_EXT are reserved for external peripherals in the AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: IO Mode (N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX) 000: Normal input/output: (Y_int=Y_pad, A_pad=A_int) 001: Inverted input/ouput: (Y_int=not(Y_pad), A_pad=not(A_int)) 010: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

Undefined behavior. 100: Open Drain, Normal input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0 , Y_int = Y_pad) 101: Open Drain, inverted input / output (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 0, Y_int = (not Y_pad)) 110: Open Source, Normal input/outut (GZ_pad = (not A_int) or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = Y_pad ) 111: Open Source: Inverted input/output (GZ_pad = A_int or GZ_int, A_PAD = 1, Y_int = (not Y_pad))

field.name: RESERVED1
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: TDI
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDI It must always be one IO that is set as TDI. If another IO is set as TDI, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: TDO
field.description: 1:IO enabled as JTAG TDO It must always be one IO that is set as TDO. If another IO is set as TDO, this bit will be cleared. Will not be cleared if writing '0' to it.

field.name: EDINT
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if edge detection is enabled) 0: No interrupt generation

field.name: EDET
field.description:
Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO.
00: No edge detection 01: Negative edge detection 10: Positive edge detection 11: Positive and negative edge detection

field.name: RESERVED0
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PULLEN
field.description: 11: No pull 10: Pull up 01: Pull down 00: Reserved

field.name: IOSC
field.description: 1: Enables slew control on output

field.name: IOCC
field.description: Selects IO current in combination with IOSTR 00: 2mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 00) 01: 4mA (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 01) 10: 4 or 8mA (8 mA if master is double drive strength) Setting sets IO_EC,IO_HC= 11) 11: up to 16 mA (for double bonded pads (Sets IO_EC,IO_HC=11 on all connected pads)

field.name: IOSTR
field.description: Select drive strength IO 00: Automatic drive strength (2/4/8mA@VDDS) 01: Minimum drive strength (2/4/8mA@3.3V) 10: Medium drive strength (2/4/8mA@2.5V) 11: Maximum drive strength (2/4/8mA@1.8V)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: PORTID
field.description:
PORTID=0: Selects GPIO (#N) >0 Selects peripheral port # PORTID. Except PORTID=8 which is reserved for AUX.
Ports with PORTID from 1 to PORTCNT_EXT are reserved for external peripherals in the AON domain.

field.name: RESERVED2
field.description: Byte fill

field.name: IOIH
field.description: 1: Input hysteresis enable

field.name: IOIE
field.description:
0: Input disabled 1: Input enabled
Note: If IO is configured for AUX the enable will be ignored.

field.name: SHUTDOWN
field.description:
(N/A for IO configured for AON peripheral signals and AUX) 0d: No wake-up 10: Input with shutdown wake-up on low: (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=0, GZ=1) 11: Input with shutdown wake-up on high (WUEN_pad=1, A_pad=1, GZ=1)
Note: Enable wake-up from sleep if IE=”1” only (see [13])

field.name: IOMODE
field.description: IO Mode (N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX) 000: Normal input/output: (Y_int=Y_pad, A_pad=A_int) 001: Inverted input/ouput: (Y_int=not(Y_pad), A_pad=not(A_int)) 010: Reserved. Undefined behavior. 011: Reserved. field.name: SELECT
field.description: Select which domain in the CC26xx that drives the observation output and observation clock output 000: None 001: MCU 010: AUX 011: AON 100: ANA1 101: ANA2 110: DEBUG SS 111: None

field.description: Select observation output[3] to AUX

field.name: SELECT2
field.description: Select observation output[2] to AUX

field.name: SELECT1
field.description: Select observation output[1] to AUX

field.name: SELECT0
field.description: Select observation output[0] to AUX

register.name: OBSERVESUBDOMAIN
register.description: Sub domain configuration of observation MUX

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SELECT
field.description: Select vector sent towards sub domain chosen in OBSERVEDOMAIN register

register.name: OBSERVEMCUDOMAIN
register.description: Configuration of the final stage of observation MUX in MCU domain

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SELECTFINALSTAGEMSB
field.description: Select for the final stage of the observation MUX in MCU domain. 0: Discrete vector to output[15:8] 1: Bus vector to output[15:8]

field.name: SELECTFINALSTAGELSB
field.description: Select for the final stage of the observation MUX in MCU domain. 0: Discrete vector to output[7:0] 1: Bus vector to output[7:0]

field.name: SELECTBUS
field.description: Select MCU submodule that will output signals on MCU observation vector[15:0] for bus signals.

field.name: SELECTDISCRETE3
field.description: Select MCU submodule that will output signals on MCU observation vector[15:12] for discrete signals.

field.name: SELECTDISCRETE2
field.description: Select MCU submodule that will output signals on MCU observation vector[11:8] for discrete signals.

field.name: SELECTDISCRETE1
field.description: Select MCU submodule that will output signals on MCU observation vector[7:4] for discrete signals.

field.name: SELECTDISCRETE0
field.description: Select MCU submodule that will output signals on MCU observation vector[3:0] for discrete signals.

register.name: OBSERVEMCUMODULEBUS
register.description: Configuration of bus vector observation MUX inside chosen MCU submodule.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SELECT
field.description: Bus select sent towards all MCU submodules

register.name: OBSERVEMCUMODULEDISCRETE
register.description: Configuration of discrete vector observation MUX inside chosen MCU submodule.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Fill to 32 bit

field.name: SELECT
field.description: Select sent towars MCU submodule

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable FPB Logic

field.name: KEY
field.description: FPB Write Unlock Key

field.name: NUM_CODE3_0
field.description: Number of Remapped Codes 3..0

field.name: NUM_LIT
field.description: Number of Remapped Literals

field.name: NUM_CODE6_4
field.description: Number of Remapped Codes 6..4

field.name: REMAP_ADDR
field.description: Remap Address
